description: To the Editor:

title: The Whispering Leaves of the Hiroshima Ginkgo Trees
description: DURHAM, N.C.  On Aug. 6, 1945, a 14-year-old schoolboy named Akihiro Takahashi was knocked unconscious by a deafening roar and a flash of blinding light. When he awoke, he found that he had been thrown many yards by the detonation of the atom bomb dropped on Hiroshima. He had survived because his school was about a mile from the epicenter of the blast.

title: Lawmakers Toured the Subway to Hear Commuters Complaints. They Got an Earful.
description: Sheryl Acevedos complaint was about an escalator at the East Broadway subway stop on the Lower East Side of Manhattan that rarely seems to work. That makes life difficult for Ms. Acevedo, 61, and her husband, Raymond, 63, a retired ironworker who uses a walker and travels to the neighborhood for therapy sessions.

title: The Meaning of Despacito in the Age of Trump
description: On Friday, Despacito, the hit song by the Puerto Rican artists Luis Fonsi and Daddy Yankee, became the most watched video on YouTube ever, with nearly three billion views. And it got there faster than any music video in history. Just over two weeks ago Universal Music announced it was also the most streamed song in history, if you combine the number of times people played the original song or video with a remixed version featuring vocals from the Canadian singer Justin Bieber.

title: North Korea Could Lose $1 Billion in Exports Under U.N. Measure
description: The United States hit North Korea at the United Nations on Friday with a proposed set of unprecedented economic penalties, punctuated by a one-third cut in its export revenue, to punish the isolated country for its missile and nuclear tests.

title: A New Democratic Slogan? Your Choices
description: A common theme was clear as readers offered more than 1,200 alternatives to the Democrats new slogan, A Better Deal: The party needs to offer a positive, inclusive, empathetic message. Variations of We the People and The Real Deal were especially popular.

title: Is Arcade Fire Its Own Worst Enemy?
description: The Popcast is hosted by Jon Caramanica, a pop music critic for The New York Times. It covers the latest in pop music criticism, trends and news.

title: Macron Takes On Frances Labor Code, 100 Years in the Making
description: PARIS  It is a mind-numbing 3,324 pages long and growing. Of those, 170 pages govern firings, 420 regulate health and security, 50 temporary work and 85 collective negotiations. Hundreds more are devoted to wages, specific industries and overseas departments.

title: Friday Night Music: Im With Her At Beacon Theater
description: Ive really let the music posts slide in the Trump era; to be honest, my heart wasnt in it for a while. But life must go on, and last night I did make it to a wonderful concert with Im With Her and Punch Brothers. Heres my video: visual quality from the iPhone not great, but you can get a sense, and the sound is pretty good!

title: Wine Bottles, Twigs and Trash Cans Join the Mostly Mozart Orchestra
description: It was an unusual sight at a concert by the Mostly Mozart Festival Orchestra.

title: Robert Hardy, a Frequent Churchill and a Potter Wizard, Dies at 91
description: Robert Hardy, the veteran British character actor whose roles included Cornelius Fudge in four Harry Potter movies, an eccentric veterinary surgeon in All Creatures Great and Small and numerous incarnations of Winston Churchill, died on Thursday in London. He was 91.

title: The Pianist Jeremy Denk on the Joys of Chopin, Our Most Catlike Composer
description: A vivid memory from the early 1990s: My piano teacher was giving me hell for not observing some pedal markings in Chopin when he reached for his lighter, to smoke away the aggravation Id caused. Mid-reach he stopped, suddenly inspired.

title: A Few Telling Freshman Trends
description: How are new students feeling? What matters to them? Are they where they want to be? The Higher Education Research Institute at U.C.L.A., which has been surveying first-year students across the country for more than half a century, has some answers.

title: On the PGA Tour, a Slice of Humble Pie
description: AKRON, Ohio  Once in a while the card-carrying members of the PGA Tour provide proof that they are just like us. On Sunday at the Canadian Open, Kevin Chappell, who began his round one stroke off the lead, took a restricted swing from near a bush and failed to make contact with his ball.

title: Surprise Fireworks: This Weeks 8 Best Classical Music Moments on YouTube
description: In addition to writing reviews, features and news during the week, our critics and reporters collect the best of what theyve heard: notes that sent shivers down their spines, memorable voices, quotations that cut to the heart of the story. This week, were offering a glimpse into the research weve done on YouTube for articles.

title: Open Thread: This Week in Style News
description: Each week, the Open Thread newsletter will offer a look from across The New York Times at the forces that shape the dress codes we share, with Vanessa Friedman as your personal shopper. The latest newsletter appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Scorpions Are Ancient, but Some Species Are New to Science
description: Scorpions are ancient. They have been on earth some 435 million years. Some of the older creatures, the ancestors of modern scorpions, grew to a length of up to four feet. Some of todays scorpions can kill human beings, while others rarely sting or have venom that doesnt affect humans or other mammals.

title: Jeff Sessions, Martin Shkreli, The Dark Tower: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Its Better to Swim Alone, Yet Together, if Youre a Salp
description: What mysterious, gelatinous, clear blob that you might find washed up on a beach looks like a jellyfish but isnt? Meet the sea salp. It typically lives in deep waters, where its barrel-shaped body glides around the ocean by jet propulsion, sucking in water from a siphon on one end and spitting it back though another. It swims alone for part of its life. But it spends the rest of it with other salps, linked together in chains arranged as wheels, lines or other architectural designs.

title: Outer Banks Businesses Tally Their Losses After Power Is Restored
description: A week after construction workers accidentally plunged parts of the Outer Banks of North Carolina into darkness and forced tens of thousands of visitors to evacuate, some of its normal summer character returned on Friday.

title: Ted Stanley, Whose Fentanyl Lollipop Treated Chronic Pain, Dies at 77
description: Ted Stanley, an anesthesiologist and medical entrepreneur who, with a colleague, created the fentanyl lollipop, a palatable means of delivering a synthetic opioid analgesic, mostly to cancer patients, died on July 13 in Salt Lake City. He was 77.

title: With Trump on Vacation, a Sprucing Up for the West Wing
description: WASHINGTON  The moment President Trump left Washington aboard Air Force One on Friday, bound for the New Jersey golf course where he will spend his summer vacation, a White House employee switched off the air-conditioning in the West Wing to turn the area officially into a construction zone.

title: First N.F.L. Concussion Payments Are Approved, but Some May Miss Out
description: Almost four years after the N.F.L. agreed to pay hundreds of millions of dollars to ex-players who said the league had concealed the dangers of concussions from them, the first payouts  some worth as much as $5 million  have been approved.

title: Corrections: August 5, 2017
description: BUSINESS DAY

title: U.S. Names Coach for Olympic Team That Will Lack N.H.L. Faces
description: PLYMOUTH, Mich.  U.S.A. Hockey announced Friday that Tony Granato, the head coach at the University of Wisconsin, would coach the United States Olympic team at the 2018 Games in South Korea, and revealed some of its plan for building a roster without N.H.L. players.

title: Quotation of the Day: Jails Fill With Opioid Users, but Few Treat Them
description: We dont take away peoples insulin or their asthma inhalers. Why should we take away their methadone?

title: Mueller Seeks White House Documents on Flynn
description: WASHINGTON  Investigators working for the special counsel, Robert S. Mueller III, recently asked the White House for documents related to the former national security adviser Michael T. Flynn, and have questioned witnesses about whether he was secretly paid by the Turkish government during the final months of the presidential campaign, according to people close to the investigation.

title: Psychic Saw a New Home in Her Future, Before Crossing Paths With Police
description: The woman known in her upscale Connecticut community as the Greenwich Psychic answered a reporters ring of the buzzer in Manhattan on Thursday and, clearly irritated, nonetheless offered a glimpse at the gift for which she gained repute.

title: Richard Dudman, Reporter at Center of Historys Churn, Dies at 99
description: Richard Dudman, a much-traveled reporter for The St. Louis Post-Dispatch who spent more than a month in captivity in Cambodia after being ambushed by Vietcong fighters and later survived an assassination attempt after meeting the Cambodian dictator Pol Pot, died on Thursday in Blue Hill, Me. He was 99.

title: How This U.S. Tech Giant Is Backing Chinas Tech Ambitions
description: As the Chinese government develops drones, the American technology giant Qualcomm is helping. The same goes for artificial intelligence, mobile technology and supercomputers. Qualcomm is also working to help Chinese companies like Huawei break into overseas markets in support of Chinas go global campaign to develop big multinational brands.

title: Nebraska State Patrol Problems Go Beyond Perverse Medical Exam, Report Finds
description: A lawsuit filed by a member of the Nebraska State Patrol contained a shocking allegation against the agency: A male doctor working for the patrol had instructed her to expose her genitalia during a pre-employment physical exam.

title: Trump Defends McMaster Against Calls for His Firing
description: President Trump defended Lt. Gen. H. R. McMaster, his embattled national security adviser, on Friday in the face of a full-bore campaign by the nationalist wing of his political coalition accusing him of undermining the presidents agenda and calling for his dismissal.

title: Gene Editing for Designer Babies? Highly Unlikely, Scientists Say
description: Now that science is a big step closer to being able to fiddle with the genes of a human embryo, is it time to panic? Could embryo editing spiral out of control, allowing parents to custom-order a baby with Lin-Manuel Mirandas imagination or Usain Bolts speed?

title: Lets Make a Wall Deal
description: Its been a busy time for border wall aficionados. Seems like every day theres a new dramatic development:

title: Pulling Back the Curtain on Poetry
description: Everybody knows that a finished piece of writing rarely springs, fully formed, from the authors mind. But how does it get from there to here? The cover of this weeks Book Review features the marked-up draft of a poem by Eduardo C. Corral  one of a series of such annotated manuscripts, from six different poets, that anchor a special poetry-themed issue. I love seeing drafts for the same reason I love seeing artists sketches: because they show the mind at play, solving creative problems, and they illuminate the sometimes painstaking process behind the finished piece. They let us eavesdrop on a kind of dialogue or argument between the writer and the work itself. I have long been on the lookout for an opportunity to bring in-the-works drafts into the Book Review, and the poetry issue offered a perfect fit.

title: Venezuelas New Leaders Begin Their March Toward Total Control
description: BOGOT, Colombia  Members of President Nicols Maduros governing party marched triumphantly into Venezuelas Capitol building on Friday, calling to order a 545-member body with plans to rewrite the Constitution and consolidate their power over the nation.

title: Donors, Fund-Raisers, Friends: Gaining Access to De Blasios City Hall
description: For Jona S. Rechnitz and Jeremiah Reichberg, giving money to Mayor Bill de Blasios political campaigns offered a backstage pass to city government. They exchanged friendly emails with the mayor and got access to high-level officials to discuss business they had with the city.

title: Hometown Boy Doesnt Make Good
description: It didnt sit well with many in upstate New York when President Trump told them that they live in an area that just isnt working and ought to move elsewhere, like maybe Wisconsin. Its O.K., he said in an interview with The Wall Street Journal. Dont worry about your house.

title: Yellow Fever Outbreak That Threatened Brazils Megacities Ends
description: An alarming outbreak of yellow fever that threatened Brazil early this year appears to be over, according to data released this week by the Pan American Health Organization.

title: Regulators Investigating Ford Police Vehicles for Possible Exhaust Hazard
description: In February, police officers in Austin, Tex., began complaining of dizziness and headaches while driving Ford sport utility vehicles that are specially made for law enforcement use. City officials suspected the cause was carbon monoxide leaking from the exhaust system.

title: Good Retirement, Sweet Prince
description: There are not many people who in their lifetime have had films made about them, had their image stamped onto a coin or had their obituary printed. But then not that many people have maintained an arduous work schedule in a highly visible job to the age of 96, as has Prince Philip, the Duke of Edinburgh and consort of Queen Elizabeth II who retired this week. He has royally earned the right to rest (some would say so has his wife, but then shes only 91).

title: We Do Not See Things as They Are
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  Its not really a secret that we all see, feel, smell and hear things differently. If you have ever sat through a course in philosophy, you know that our perception of what is real is based not on what something actually is, but what we say it is. Which is always incredibly disappointing to a teenager who has come to college to discover the real world (Thats it?! Thats all there is to it? Can I go now?)

title: No Sanctuary for the Immigration Lawyer
description: NEW HAVEN  Across two decades as an immigration lawyer practicing the quieter arts of saving clients from federal deportation, Glenn Formica never thought highly of the tactic of seeking refuge in a church, where law enforcement is hesitant to intrude. He was skeptical of the sanctuary approach, and the ephemeral hopes he thought it generated in trying to shield undocumented immigrants in dramatic standoffs with authorities.

title: Why Trump Supporters Distrust Immigration and Diversity
description: President Trumps support for a proposal from Senators Tom Cotton and David Perdue that slashes legal immigration and reports about the Justice Departments renewed interests in scrutinizing college affirmative action programs should come as no surprise. Mr. Trump is catering to his largely middle-aged, white, middle- and working-class base. Thats what politicians do.

title: What Was Australia Doing in Vietnam?
description: In July 1967 President Lyndon B. Johnson sent two of his principal advisers, Clark Clifford and Gen. Maxwell Taylor, to Australia and New Zealand with an urgent mission. Protests were raging in American streets and on university campuses. Hawks and doves were battling in Washington. Defense Secretary Robert McNamara was heading toward resignation, an admission that his Vietnam policy had failed.

title: Fred Leighton, a Jeweler Who Made Stars Glitter, Dies at 85
description: Fred Leighton, a so-called jeweler to the stars whose antique jewelry became coveted accessories for actresses like Nicole Kidman and Lupita Nyongo when they walked the red carpet of the Academy Awards, died on July 26 in Manhattan. He was 85.

title: Wells Fargo May Have Found More Fake Accounts Created by Employees
description: Wells Fargo, already struggling to rebuild its reputation after a scandal over the creation of fraudulent bank accounts, signaled on Friday that it could have more bad news coming.

title: Growing Pains and Struggling Offense Sink the Yankees in Cleveland
description: CLEVELAND  The talent the young Yankees flash can be seductive, making it easy to forget that there is still a refinement process that comes with it. The rough edges to a prospects game  even the ones that are not readily apparent  need time to be smoothed out.

title: On Raucous Night in Queens, Mets Are an Afterthought
description: If the Mets were hoping for a gentle transition for Amed Rosario, the jewel of their farm system, into the pressure cooker of New York baseball, they could have hardly picked a better night for his Citi Field debut.

title: Nissan Workers in Mississippi Reject Union Bid by U.A.W.
description: In a test of labors ability to expand its reach in the South, workers at a Nissan plant in Mississippi have overwhelmingly rejected a bid to unionize.

title: Mo Farah Wins 10,000 at Worlds Before Home Crowd
description: Mo Farah launched the world championships in scintillating fashion Friday with another consummate 10,000-meter victory that further embellished his claim to being the greatest distance racer. With 55,000 of his home fans roaring their support at London Stadium, Farah, 34, of Britain sprinted away with a gold medal in a global track final for a 10th consecutive time.

title: Whats on TV Saturday: Icarus and Rachel Getting Married
description: In Icarus, Bryan Fogel sets out to test doping in cycling and ends up embroiled in an international scandal. And the movie Rachel Getting Married, Jonathan Demmes loving tale of family dysfunction, comes to Hulu.

title: Republican Senator Is on a Mission to Rescue the Health Care Law
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Lamar Alexander voted to repeal the Affordable Care Act numerous times and wanted it gone. Now he is trying to save it  at least for the moment.

title: Britain Turns to Chinese Textbooks to Improve Its Math Scores
description: BEIJING  Educators around the world were stunned when students in Shanghai came first in their international standardized testing debut, in 2010, besting their counterparts in dozens of countries in what some called a Sputnik-like moment.

title: Canada Letter: Spurning Silicon Valley and Rocks Native Roots
description: When it comes to technology, Canada  as well as Mexico and China  is expanding, at the expense of the United States. Thats what Kirk Semple, one of my colleagues based in Mexico, and I found out and wrote about recently.

title: A San Francisco Hotel Wired for a Tech Central Crowd
description: From $279.

title: Im Still Overweight, but Much Happier and Healthier
description: Here are the top 10 comments of the week on our digital platforms, as selected by our readers and the journalists who moderate nearly every comment. Some comments were edited for length and clarity.

title: A Ride for the Red Planet
description: Step inside this Mars rover concept vehicle created as part of the Kennedy Space Centers Summer of Mars campaign to celebrate advances in exploration of the planet.

title: In Weary Wisconsin Town, a Billionaire-Fueled Revival
description: BELOIT, Wis.  When Diane Hendricks sees something she doesnt like here, she buys it.

title: In Afghanistan, U.S. Exits, and Iran Comes In
description: FARAH, Afghanistan  A police officer guarding the outskirts of this city remembers the call from his commander, warning that hundreds of Taliban fighters were headed his way.

title: On Irish Border, Worries That Brexit Will Undo a Hard-Won Peace
description: LONDONDERRY, Northern Ireland  Crossing the border between Northern Ireland and the Irish Republic used to involve delays, checkpoints, bureaucratic harassment and the lurking threat of violence. That its now virtually seamless  that you can drive across without even knowing it  feels close to miraculous.

title: A Flawed Asylum System in Mexico, Strained Further by U.S. Changes
description: MEXICO CITY  As the Trump administration pushes forward with its plans to harden the southwest border, Mexico has found itself under pressure to take in an increasing number of asylum seekers making their way north from Central America, many of them fleeing  gang violence.

title: North Korean Defector, Treated Like Dirt in South, Fights to Return
description: SEOUL, South Korea  Divorced and out of money, Kwon Chol-nam fled North Korea for China in 2014 by wading across a river border at night and then crawling over a barbed-wire fence. After a perilous trek that included walking through a jungle in Laos, he reached Thailand, where he was allowed to fly to South Korea to start a new life.

title: For a Couple a Combined 171 Years Old, a Young Love
description: Dr. John Vincent Abbott Jr. and Dr. E. Gerald Dabbs were married Aug. 5 in the ballroom of Dr. Abbotts home in Ridgefield, Conn. Patricia E. Henry, a retired State Supreme Court justice in Brooklyn, officiated.

title: Firming Up Tentative Plans
description: Carla Nasr and Levi Watson Azia Quaintance were married Aug. 5 at Jefferson Market Garden in Manhattan. Erin E. Reitz, a friend of the couple who was ordained by the American Marriage Ministries, officiated.

title: Losing an Auction Resulted in a Win
description: Jessica Hope Morganoff and Gideon Yaacov Sims were married on Aug. 5 at Battery Gardens in New York. Cantor Neil A. Berris led the ceremony.

title: Of Mice and Men Like Mick Jagger: A Literary Scion Tells All
description: One might reasonably assume that Natasha Fraser-Cavassoni, the youngest daughter of the English historian and novelist Lady Antonia Fraser and the late politician Sir Hugh Fraser, had a posh upbringing. Private schools. Pretty clothes. A retreat in Scotland.

title: Jeannette Walls Settles Down Far From the Noise of New York
description: ORANGE, Va.  Early in the The Glass Castle, the movie based on Jeannette Wallss memoir of growing up destitute, Rex Walls sidles up to his little girl, who lies burned and bandaged in a hospital bed.

title: A Hollywood Party Planner Who Isnt Instagram-Obsessed
description: LOS ANGELES  As the evening sky faded to bluish white, Yifat Oren, 45, surveyed her handiwork. Dont light the candles just yet, the event producer said to one of her assistants. We need to wait for the wind to die down. Another assistant was sent to fetch the seating chart for a quick rearrangement.

title: SoHos New Geeks
description: We wanted to see where stylish New York teenagers were gravitating. We found that just as music and fashion brought young people together in the past, streetwear and skater brands are bringing them together today.

title: George Saunders on the Price of Dreams
description: How does anyone afford to have children? Thats a question the Sugars receive in this weeks episode from a woman who calls herself Broke Potential Mother.

title: In a Swimmers Two-Year Quest, a Final 21-Mile Challenge
description: Antonio Argelles, 58, rose near dawn Thursday hoping for good fortune.

title: Singapore Orders Expulsion of American Academic
description: BANGKOK  Singapore has ordered the expulsion of a noted American academic for what it said was his covert effort to influence Singapores foreign policy on behalf of an unnamed foreign government.

title: Female Lawmaker in Pakistan Accuses Imran Khan of Inappropriate Texts. Abuse Follows.
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  When a Pakistani lawmaker said this past week that she had received inappropriate text messages from a male colleague, she was met with a wave of vitriol on social media.

title: Farhads and Mikes Week in Tech: A Snap and Google Tie-Up?
description: Each Saturday, Farhad Manjoo and Mike Isaac, technology reporters at The New York Times, review the weeks news, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two about the most important developments in the tech industry.

title: Can a Stroller Be Sent to the Back Door?
description: Q. About a month ago, my husband and I bought a co-op in Fort Greene, Brooklyn. Several times a day, we put our baby in a stroller and leave the building through the front door. As we returned home through that door recently, a person, who we believe works for the managing agent, told us that strollers must use a back entrance. An avid rule follower, I reread the resident handbook and found no rule about this. If a rule is not written, must it be followed?

title: Racial Violence on the Screen
description: In the thick of Detroit, a new film by Kathryn Bigelow about the uprising in that city  my native city  50 years ago, a white cop kills a black man. His partner then asks a witness, a black man, what he saw. The witness says he saw nothing. The partner puts the same question to another witness, a black teen, who refuses to play along.

title: Texts on a Plane About Child Molestation Lead to Two Arrests
description: On a flight from Seattle to San Jose, Calif., on Monday, a woman caught a glimpse of some text messages that alarmed her.

title: Being a Refugee Isnt a Fashion Statement
description: Its August in New York  a time when arriving to work from the subway and not looking like a drowned rat is a sartorial victory. What should working women wear to beat the heat? Linen, perhaps a romper. Or you could don the Refugee Dress.

title: Republican Shadow Campaign for 2020 Takes Shape as Trump Doubts Grow
description: WASHINGTON  Senators Tom Cotton and Ben Sasse have already been to Iowa this year, Gov. John Kasich is eyeing a return visit to New Hampshire, and Mike Pences schedule is so full of political events that Republicans joke that he is acting more like a second-term vice president hoping to clear the field than a No. 2 sworn in a little over six months ago.

title: Recipe for a Run: Add Bullpen Muscle
description: Kenley Jansen was asleep on the Los Angeles Dodgers charter plane on Monday when David Vassegh, the teams radio beat reporter, awoke him with news: The Dodgers had acquired Yu Darvish, an All-Star starting pitcher, in a trade with the Texas Rangers. Jansen, the Dodgers closer, had a curious reaction.

title: Variety: Acrostic
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  Usually, I can make my way into an acrostic by finding some gimmes, or answers that I know right off the bat. There are always a few of them, although the exact number depends on the puzzle itself. From there, I try to toggle between filling in the words in the grid and solving the clues.

title: U.A.W. Accuses Nissan of Scare Tactics as Workers Reject Union Bid
description: In a test of labors ability to expand its reach in the South, workers at a Nissan plant in Mississippi overwhelmingly rejected a bid to unionize, an election that the union quickly criticized.

title: Pakistans Ousted Leader Criticizes Court Ruling and Plans Public Rally
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  Pakistans ousted prime minister, Nawaz Sharif, sharply criticized the Supreme Court verdict that forced him to step down last week and said he was planning a big rally in his hometown, Lahore, to galvanize public support for his political party and his future.

title: All Eyes Are on Tillerson and North Korean Counterpart at Asean Meeting
description: MANILA  Secretary of State Rex W. Tillerson will for the first time on Sunday be in the same room with his North Korean counterpart, and much of the world will be watching for whether the two even acknowledge each other.

title: Affirmative Action Policies Evolve, Achieving Their Own Diversity
description: Just a year ago, after the Supreme Court rejected a challenge to the University of Texas at Austins admissions program by a single swing vote, the question seemed to be edging, at last, toward an answer: Colleges could, the justices ruled, consider race when deciding whom to let through their gates.

title: Search Is Suspended for 3 Missing Marines Off Australia
description: Officials have suspended the search for three missing United States Marines after an MV-22 Osprey, a hybrid aircraft, entered the water off the eastern coast of Australia around 4 p.m. local time on Saturday.

title: Bobby Sticks It to Trump
description: WASHINGTON  As we contemplate crime and punishment in the Trump circle, it should be noted that our Russia-besotted president does share some traits with Dostoyevskys spiraling protagonist, Rodion Raskolnikov.

title: An Elusive Immigration Compromise
description: The last time Gallup asked Americans if they thought immigration to the United States should increase or decrease, 35 percent chose a decrease, 24 percent an increase, and 38 percent preferred the present rate. Support for increasing immigration has been rising for a decade, but it remains relatively low. To the extent that there is a middle-ground position, it is for something like the status quo.

title: When Will the Tech Bubble Burst?
description: At the height of a market mania in 1967, the author George Goodman captured the mood perfectly, comparing it to a surreal party that ends only when black horsemen burst through the doors and cut down all the revelers who remain. Those who leave early are saved, but the ball is so splendid no one wants to leave while there is still time. So everybody keeps asking  what time is it? But none of the clocks have hands.

title: Whats the Deal, Mr. Trump?
description: President Trump promised hed make so many great deals that wed all get tired of winning. Hes certainly left Americans feeling worn out, but not because of any transactional whirlwind.

title: As Others Pack, Some Millennials Commit to Puerto Rico
description: SAN JUAN, P.R.  Two young graduates from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology did the unthinkable last summer: They quit enviable jobs in New York and moved back to beleaguered Puerto Rico, bringing their plan for a start-up with them.

title: The Policies of White Resentment
description: White resentment put Donald Trump in the White House. And there is every indication that it will keep him there, especially as he continues to transform that seething, irrational fear about an increasingly diverse America into policies that feed his supporters worst racial anxieties.

title: Hire Women Your Moms Age
description: Theres something haywire about how women are expected to crunch our most celebrated achievements into a timetable that frequently lasts fewer than 20 years. Find a partner. Raise some chicks. Zoom to the top of your field. Check each box by 50.

title: Is Trumps Turmoil Slowing Economic Growth?
description: At the end of last month, the International Monetary Fund downgraded its forecast for economic growth in the United States. Where the I.M.F. previously predicted the economy would grow at a rate of 2.3 percent in 2017 and 2.5 percent in 2018, it now expects 2.1 percent growth in both years.

title: Vladimir Putins Summer Vacation: A Siberia Scrapbook
description: What did President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia do on his summer vacation?

title: Should I Help My Patients Die?
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  I WAS leafing through a patients chart last year when a colleague tapped me on the shoulder. I have a patient who is asking about the End of Life Option Act, he said in a low voice. Can we even do that here?

title: Venezuelas Ousted Attorney General Retreats on a Motorbike
description: BOGOT, Colombia  Venezuelas dissident attorney general sped away from her headquarters on a motorbike on Saturday as she was being ousted by the countrys new all-powerful assembly, which moved toward a swift consolidation of its power.

title: A Feminist Defense of Bridezillas
description: For many of the thousands of American weddings that have taken place so far this summer, there have been two unspoken requirements: 1) that the events be stunning, awe-inspiring, love-filled, unique and fun all at once, and 2) that they appear to have occurred miraculously, with zero effort or emotional output on the part of the bride.

title: The 30-Somethings Guide to Real Estate
description: LINCOLN, NEB.  My parents threw me a surprise party when I graduated from college. I was the first in my family to do so, and it was, in many ways, a party for all of us. They rented a banquet hall, invited everyone they felt had played a key part in my arriving at that moment  and told me we were going to a cousins baby shower. Shortly after everyone yelled surprise, my dad took the microphone and started the festivities by introducing one of the few white American families there.

title: U.N. Security Council Imposes Punishing New Sanctions on North Korea
description: UNITED NATIONS  The United Nations Security Council on Saturday unanimously adopted a resolution to impose the most punishing sanctions yet against North Korea over its repeated defiance of a ban on testing missiles and nuclear bombs.

title: Fox News Suspends Eric Bolling After Report of Lewd Text Messages
description: Fox News suspended Eric Bolling, a longtime host at the network, on Saturday pending an investigation into reports that he sent lewd photographs to three female colleagues via text message.

title: Pulling Back on the Barbaric Use of Solitary Confinement
description: The Justice Department took a farsighted step last year when it banned the use of solitary confinement for young people in federal prisons. The decision  based on research showing that isolation promotes mental illness and self-harm  followed the widely publicized suicide of Kalief Browder, a young man who had been unjustly accused of a minor crime and sent to New Yorks infamous Rikers Island jail complex, where he spent two traumatic years in solitary confinement.

title: Minnesota Mosque Hit by Early-Morning Explosion
description: An early-morning blast rocked the Dar Al Farooq mosque in Bloomington, Minn., on Saturday, as worshipers had just begun to gather inside for morning prayers.

title: Trumps Travel Ban Means Hope for Ammars Family
description: With almost no refugees arriving, a sponsor offers to help those already here.

title: Usain Bolt, in a Narrow Defeat, Leaves Behind a Yawning Chasm
description: LONDON  The moment and the crowd of 55,900 at London Stadium were his, and Usain Bolt was inches from a clean getaway.

title: Theyre Building a Trump-Centric Movement. But Dont Call It Trumpism.
description: GLENDORA, Calif.  Theyre the first to admit that trying to reorient conservatism and the Republican Party around a president who does not consider himself much of a conservative or a Republican is a bit of a riddle.

title: Anchors Away!
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  It doesnt happen often, but sometimes the stars align in my job and I am able to metaphorically and completely accidentally injure two birds with one stone. Today is one of those days.

title: Judge Drops Rape Case Against U.S.C. Student, Citing Video Evidence
description: In the early hours of April 1, neither student at the University of Southern California knew what the other had had to drink. An Uber was called, and the male student was seen on video following the female student into her dorm, where they had sex.

title: Kidnappers Plotted to Sell British Model Online, Italian Police Say
description: A Polish citizen has been charged with kidnapping a 20-year-old British model in what the Italian authorities said Saturday was part of a scheme to sell the woman on a pornography website.

title: Quotation of the Day: Risking Death, He Fled North Korea. Now Hes Begging to Return.
description: You have to ride a horse to know whether its the right mount for you. I have tried, and the South is not for me.

title: Corrections: August 6, 2017
description: NATIONAL

title: After Powerful Start, Mets Drop Their Third Straight
description: This is the difference between a good, and possibly great, baseball team, and an unquestionably bad one: Six times, the Mets have played the Los Angeles Dodgers this season. Six times, the Mets have lost. The combined score of those games, including Saturdays 7-4 Dodgers victory at Citi Field, is 49-15. And in those six games, the Dodgers have hit 23 home runs.

title: Aroldis Chapman Escapes an Eerily Familiar Tight Spot in Yankees Victory
description: CLEVELAND  Rajai Davis may be long gone, but for Yankees closer Aroldis Chapman, the ghost of Davis was present and accounted for here Saturday night.

title: Neymar Watches as P.S.G. Wins Its Opener
description: With fireworks exploding around him, Neymar emerged onto the field to present fans in Paris with the sight they had been expecting: the worlds most expensive player in a Paris St.-Germain uniform.

title: Melissa Milich, Brian Bush
description: Melissa Brooke Milich and Brian Devereaux Bush were married Aug. 5 at the Loeb Boathouse in Central Park. Rabbi Lisa Rubin officiated.

title: Michelle Arbour, Ryan Scoggins
description: Michelle Arbour and Dr. Ryan Hoffman Scoggins were married Aug. 5 in Oakdale, N.Y. The Hon. Eileen Rakower, a justice of the Supreme Court in New York, officiated at the Bourne Mansion.

title: Rebecca Mann, James Platts
description: Rebecca Mann and James Thayer Platts were married Aug. 5 at Rays Boathouse in Seattle. Bradley L. Tytel, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated.

title: Natalie Gontcharova, Nicholas Carbone
description: Natalie Gontcharova and Nicholas Andrew Carbone were married Aug. 5 at the Meridian House, a mansion in Washington. The Very Rev. David B. Lett, a priest with the Old Catholic Diocese of New Jersey, officiated.

title: Alison Macbeth, Daniel Cook
description: Alison Carol Macbeth and Daniel David Cook were married Aug. 4. The Rev. Egill Hallgrimsson, a Lutheran pastor, officiated at the Budir Church in Budir, a hamlet on the Snaefellsnes Peninsula in Iceland.

title: Charles Sellew, David Fiocco
description: Charles Samuel Sellew and David Andrew Fiocco were married Aug. 5 at the Mill City Museum in Minneapolis. The Rev. Jane McBride, a United Church of Christ minister, officiated.

title: Jessie Cohan, Jared LeBoff
description: Jessie Krane Cohan, a daughter of Cheryl L. Krane of Lake Oswego, Ore., and Robert D. Cohan of Newton, Mass., was married Aug. 5 to Jared Benjamin LeBoff, a son of Shelley F. LeBoff and Jay M. LeBoff of Beverly Hills, Calif. Larry Sanitsky, a cousin of the groom and a Universal Life minister, officiated at the home of the grooms parents.

title: Lindsay Thomson, Samuel Brill
description: Lindsay Sanders Thomson and Samuel Malcolm Brill were married Aug. 5 at the brides family home in South Londonderry, Vt. Bharat Ayyar, a friend of the couple, received permission from the Vermont secretary of state to officiate.

title: Amy Schwartz, Jonathan Klein
description: Amy Lynn Schwartz and Jonathan David Klein were married Aug. 5 at the Memorial Art Gallery in Rochester. Rabbi Mark Shulman officiated.

title: Alyson Maugeri, Jordan Albert
description: Alyson Isadora Maugeri and Jordan Harris Petersen Albert were married Aug. 4. Lauren M. Seber, a Universal Life minister, officiated at the Nassau Inn in Princeton, N.J.

title: Rina Pal, Jan Gtzen
description: Rina Pal and Jan Mirco Gtzen were married Aug. 5 at the Faculty Club at the University of California, Berkeley. The Rev. Bruce ONeill, an Episcopal priest, officiated at a German Protestant ceremony, which followed a Bengali Hindu ceremony led by Arabinda Chakrabarti, a Hindu priest.

title: Caroline Peck, Robert Love
description: Caroline Lindsay Peck, a daughter of Linda M. Peck and Staunton Peck of Summit, N.J., was married Aug. 5 to Robert Henry Love, a son of Joanne E. Love of Bernardsville, N.J., and James R. Love of New York. The Rev. Craig Swan, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony in Narragansett, R.I., at St. Peters by-the-Sea, where he is the rector.

title: Sarah Wallace, Ian Schwartz
description: Sarah Rose Wallace and Ian Gary Schwartz are to be married Aug. 6 in Beverly Hills, Calif. Rabbi Jesse M. Olitzky is to officiate at the Beverly Hills Hotel.

title: Liadan Donnelly, Aaron Plavnick
description: Liadan Elizabeth Donnelly and Aaron Daniel Plavnick were married Aug. 5 at the Columbus Park Refectory in Chicago. The officiant was Lt. Cmdr. Keith D. Plavnick of the United States Navy, the grooms father, who was ordained by the American Marriage Ministries.

title: Ashley Graf, Jonathan Spagnola
description: Ashley Gainer Graf and Dr. Jonathan Frederick Spagnola were married on Aug. 5 in New Hope, Pa. The Rev. Samuel Massengill, a Presbyterian minister, officiated at Hotel du Village, an event space.

title: Ariel Herm, Adam Koshkin
description: Ariel Rebecca Herm and Adam Levin Koshkin were married on Aug. 5 at the Squaw Valley resort in Olympic Valley, Calif. Cameron L. Scherer, a friend of the couple who introduced them, became an American Marriage Ministries minister to officiate.

title: Jessica Sleater, Jorge Montalvo
description: Jessica June Sleater and Jorge Isaac Montalvo were married Aug. 4 in Manhattan. Msgr. Kevin Sullivan performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of Our Lady of the Rosary.

title: Amber Katherine, Kimberly Russo
description: Amber L. Katherine and Kimberly Kathryn Russo are to be married Aug. 6. Richard Amir Tahvildaran-Jesswein, a friend who is a minister of the First Nation Church, is to officiate on the beach in Santa Monica, Calif. Derek Hogen Dieter, a Zen Buddhist priest, will take part in the ceremony.

title: Caroline Corbett, Nicholas Sizer
description: Caroline Alicia Corbett and Nicholas Budd Sizer were married July 31 at the Marriage Bureau in Manhattan. Angel L. Lopez, a staff member in the New York City Clerks Office, officiated.

title: Lara Crystal, Robert Saliterman
description: Lara Elizabeth Crystal and Robert Warren Saliterman were married Aug. 5. Cantor Bruce L. Ruben officiated at the Pierre, the New York hotel.

title: Justine Anania, J.D. Gross
description: Justine Elizabeth Anania and Jeremy David Gross were married Aug. 5 in Briarcliff Manor, N.Y. Rabbi Nicole Auerbach officiated at the Sleepy Hollow Country Club.

title: Allison Zeilinger, Taylor Greason
description: Allison Eileen Zeilinger and Taylor Kosa Greason were married Aug. 5 in Vail, Colo. The Rev. Jose Maria Quera, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at the Vail Chapel.

title: Christiana Stephenson, Matthew Aks
description: Christiana Elizabeth Stephenson and Matthew Louis Aks were married Aug. 5 in Manning Chapel at Brown University in Providence, R.I. The Rev. Jamie P. Washam, a Baptist minister, performed the ceremony.

title: Kathleen Ashby, Lukas Kohoutek
description: Kathleen Victoria Ashby and Lukas Kohoutek were married Aug. 5 at the Church of St. Wenceslas in Mikulov, Czech Republic. The Rev. Oldrich Chocholac, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Anja Crowder, Peter Morice
description: Anja Ramme Crowder and Peter Gunther Alexander Morice were married Aug. 5 in Combourg, France. Christiane Guervilly, the mayor of Erquy, France, officiated, with the Rev. Gareth Randall, an Anglican priest, leading a spiritual ceremony at the Chteau du Grand Val.

title: Joelle Silverman, Vladyslav Golyk
description: Joelle Marisa Silverman and Vladyslav Alexander Golyk are to be married Aug. 6 at the Brooklyn Botanic Garden. Rabbi Paula Mack Drill is to officiate.

title: Ann Wright, Manish Engineer
description: Ann Carolyn Wright and Manish Shirish Engineer were married Aug. 5 at the McDonald Observatory in Fort Davis, Tex. Judge Bryant Culpepper, a family court judge in Perry, Ga., officiated. Earlier in the day, Krishnaswamy Bhattar, a Hindu priest, led a ceremony that incorporated Hindu wedding traditions at the Capri, an event space in Marfa, Tex.

title: Lauren Haffer, Jonathan Birnbaum
description: Lauren Paige Haffer and Jonathan Adam Birnbaum are to be married Aug. 6 in Farmingdale, N.Y. Rabbi Michael Klayman is to officiate at the Carlyle on the Green, an event space.

title: Patricia Lee, David Martorana
description: Patricia Lee, the daughter of Phoebe Y. Lee and Chao L. Lee of Fullerton, Calif., was married Aug. 5 to David Michael Martorana, the son of Roberta Martorana of Richmond, Va., and Ronald K. K. Sakimura of Honolulu. Alexandra M. Armstrong, a Universal Life minister, officiated at the home of the brides parents.

title: Rimsha Ahmed, Michael Santos
description: Dr. Rimsha Ahmed and Dr. Michael Arthur Santos were married Aug. 5 at the Rodin Museum in Philadelphia. Imam Hamad A. Chebli, a Muslim cleric, officiated.

title: Melissa Kovner, Nicholas Levine
description: Melissa Mae Kovner and Nicholas Brian Levine were married Aug. 5, at Allaire Studios at Glen Tonche in Shokan, N.Y., a 22-acre estate built in 1928 by Raymond Pitcairn and used in recent years as a music recording studio. Richard Vogel, a Universal Life minister and a friend of the couple, officiated.

title: Kailan Sierra-Davidson, Alexander Loomis
description: Kailan Alysabeth Sierra-Davidson and Alexander Hale Loomis were married Aug. 5. The Rev. Gail W. Wright, a minister of the United Church of Christ, officiated at Davids Folly Farm in Brooksville, Me.

title: Khendi White, Adebanjo Solaru
description: Dr. Khendi Tahira White and Adebanjo Oluwafolayimika Solaru are to be married Aug. 6 at the Ariel International Center in Cleveland. The Rev. Larry Green, a Baptist minister, is to officiate.

title: Whats on TV Sunday: Game of Thrones and Sharknado 5: Global Swarming
description: Emilia Clarke scraps a failing plan to conquer her enemies in Game of Thrones. And Ian Ziering and Tara Reids fight against sharks gets personal.

title: When Foreign Companies Are Making, Not Killing, U.S. Jobs
description: CHATTANOOGA, Tenn.  At the airport here, there is a reminder to travelers of the jobs that global trade can bring. A shiny 2017 Volkswagen Passat is stationed near the entryway and labeled: Designed in Germany. Built in Chattanooga.

title: Transgender African-Americans Open Wound: Were Considered a Joke
description: When Elle Hearns watched the video clip someone had sent to her on social media, it really stung.

title: Let Forest Fires Burn? What the Black-Backed Woodpecker Knows
description: BUCK MEADOWS, Calif.  With long strides, Chad T. Hanson plunged into a burned-out forest, his boots kicking up powdery ash. Blackened, lifeless trees stretched toward an azure sky.

title: Mueller, Trump, Russia: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Here are the weeks top stories, and a look ahead.

title: A Communist Icon Toppled in Ukraine Is Restored. In England.
description: MANCHESTER, England  After 147 years, Friedrich Engels is back in town. Statues of Engels, Karl Marxs collaborator, may have been ripped down all over the former communist world, but he has returned here, to the city that made him famous.

title: The Atomic Bombing of Hiroshima
description: Through modeling and mapping technologies, witness from above what happened in Hiroshima, Japan on Aug. 6, 1945.

title: Chinese Tourists Arrested Over Nazi Salutes
description: BERLIN  Like millions of visitors to Germany each year, two Chinese tourists made their way this weekend to the Reichstag, seat of the lower house of Parliament, where they snapped photos of themselves outside the historic building.

title: Tillerson Hails U.N. Sanctions, as Chinese Minister Rebukes North Korea at Asean Meeting
description: MANILA  A day after the United Nations Security Council passed its toughest sanctions against North Korea, Secretary of State Rex W. Tillerson met with his South Korean and Chinese counterparts here in hopes of ratcheting up pressure on Pyongyang.

title: Detroits Mayoral Election Is a Test of Recovery and Legacy
description: DETROIT  Coleman A. Young II was settling into a diner booth with a mug of hot chocolate heaped with whipped cream when a stranger approached. I adored your father, and I hope youre just like him, she said. Hours later, as Mr. Young rode in a car along a neighborhood street, someone called out, I voted for your dad, man! And when he stood before residents of an apartment complex, a woman rose to recount her memories of Mr. Youngs father, Coleman A. Young, Detroits first black mayor. He made a whole lot of difference in this city, she said.

title: Where Were You During the Great American Eclipse of 2017?
description: As an eerie midday twilight settled over Baker, Ore., on June 8, 1918, the hearts of a group of astronomers began to sink. Clouds became dense, and their chance to watch the sun wink out was in jeopardy.

title: Bill de Blasio Will Push for Tax on Wealthy to Fix Subway
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio plans to push for a tax on wealthy New Yorkers to pay for improvements needed to address the crisis engulfing New York Citys subway, city officials said on Sunday.

title: An Ice Cream Makers Latest Recipe: Saving the Local School
description: MARKDALE, Ontario  Like hundreds of small towns in Ontario, Markdale got the bad news from the provincial government last year: Its elementary school would have to close, a victim of cost-cutting.

title: Struggling to Survive, Congregations Look to Sell Houses of Worship
description: At first glance, the preservation battle over the nearly century-old synagogue on a tree-lined block of West 93rd Street on the Upper West Side of Manhattan looks familiar, even tired. One group wants to save the stately granite building, emphasizing its history, neoclassical architecture and towering stained glass windows. Another group wants to turn it into a high-rise condominium.

title: Obama-Era Fight Over Coal Royalties Turns Into Trump-Era Alliance
description: The coal industry sued, protested and lobbied to block a rule increasing royalties for mining coal on federal land. Then President Trump was elected, and the rule was suspended. The inside story is told in documents collected by The New York Times

title: An Election Reverses Federal Coal Policy
description: The Trump administration killed an Obama-era ban on new federal coal leases. Here are the documents.

title: Under Trump, Coal Mining Gets New Life on U.S. Lands
description: DECKER, Mont.  The Trump administration is wading into one of the oldest and most contentious debates in the West by encouraging more coal mining on lands owned by the federal government. It is part of an aggressive push to both invigorate the struggling American coal industry and more broadly exploit commercial opportunities on public lands.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Good morning. Elmore Leonard once cautioned against the use of weather to open a piece of writing. The reader is apt to leaf ahead looking for people, he said. (He allowed an exception: Barry Lopez, and thats totally right. Read Arctic Dreams, and youll see why.) But Leonard never spent time on my block, this time of year, in early morning warmth with just a riffle of breeze coming down the cobblestones from the water, soft air scented with diesel and salt that flutters the leaves of the Callery pear trees, beneath a bluebird sky.

title: Political Donors Put Their Money Where the Memes Are
description: Imagine youre a millionaire or billionaire with strong political views and a desire to spread those views to the masses. Do you start a think tank in Washington? Funnel millions to a shadowy super PAC? Bankroll the campaign of an up-and-coming politician?

title: Review: Lady Gaga, the Flashy Provocateur, Battles Lady Gaga, the Raw Voice
description: TACOMA, Wash.  Lady Gaga introduced her performance of Joanne at the Tacoma Dome here on Saturday night with a long disquisition on what she called generational grief and how it shaped this song, the title track from her latest album. She dedicated the performance to people who have been affected by a pain so long-running they cant remember a time before it, and let them know that they were not alone.

title: Military Base Attacked in Venezuela as Video Calls for Rebellion
description: BOGOT, Colombia  Armed men in military uniforms and camouflage released a video early Sunday morning calling for Venezuelans to rebel against President Nicols Maduro after his party established an all-powerful assembly meant to secure its grip over the country.

title: Japan Marks Hiroshima Anniversary, With North Korea on Its Mind
description: TOKYO  Every year in early August, Japanese politicians and peace activists converge on Hiroshima to commemorate the day when the city was devastated by an American atomic bomb. In the famous peace park, the horrors of World War II are vividly recounted. Speakers of all political stripes repeat Japans postwar mantra: Never again.

title: How a Son of Sam Detective Realized This Has Got to Be the Guy
description: James Justus remembers hanging up the telephone convinced that he had something.

title: Diplomats Question Tactics of Tillerson, the Executive Turned Secretary of State
description: WASHINGTON  Several times a week the State Department sends a greeting to a foreign country on the occasion of its national day. By tradition, the salutations have been written by low-level diplomats and routinely approved by their superiors.

title: For Dodgers Star Justin Turner, the Mets Rejection Still Motivates
description: There are telephone calls that stick in the mind forever, critical conversations at pivotal moments in life. For Justin Turner, one of those calls came as he was getting into his car at his Los Angeles home on Dec. 2, 2013.

title: This Is Us Loses Emmy Nomination for Costumes
description: When the 2017 Emmy nominations were announced in June, NBCs This Is Us represented a rare bright spot for network television. The soapy family series earned 11 nominations, including one for best drama  the first time in six years that an ABC, CBS, Fox or NBC drama was nominated in that category.

title: Detroit Suffers Box-Office Setback as Dark Tower Is No. 1
description: LOS ANGELES  Kathryn Bigelows well-reviewed Detroit arrived to about $7.3 million in North American ticket sales over the weekend, a limp result for a wide-release movie that cost at least $55 million to make and market.

title: A New Adrienne Kennedy Play Will Be Staged Next Year
description: Adrienne Kennedy, whose surrealism-tinged dramas have addressed race and violence in American society since the 1960s, will have a new play, her first in nine years, as part of the coming season at Theater for a New Audience.

title: Mike Pence Rejects Report That He Is Positioning for 2020
description: Vice President Mike Pence declared his loyalty to President Trump on Sunday and denounced a New York Times article suggesting that he was positioning himself to run for president in 2020 if Mr. Trump does not seek a second term.

title: 4 Easy(ish) Ways to Save a Few Extra Bucks This Week
description: Welcome to the Smarter Living newsletter. Editor Tim Herrera emails readers once a week with tips and advice for living a better, more fulfilling life. Sign up here to get it in your inbox every Monday morning.

title: Europe Swelters Under a Heat Wave Called Lucifer
description: The meteorologists agree: The long hot spell gripping parts of Europe this past week is uncommon.

title: The Potential and Peril of Giving a Brand a Human Face
description: The actress Stephanie Courtney has quite a weight on her shoulders.

title: Countering West Coast Pull, by Helping Finance Start-Ups Sell in New York
description: When Jeff Bezos, then a New York hedge fund employee, decided to start Amazon in 1994, he quickly moved to the West Coast. So did Mark Zuckerberg, who moved from Harvard to California in 2004 to find the technology talent and financing needed to build up Facebook.

title: The Joys, and Woes, of Biking in New York
description: To the Editor:

title: Tell Us 5 Things About Your Book: A Season With Dickens, Darwin and Disraeli
description: If youre having a hard time of it during this sweltering season, just be glad you didnt live in London in 1858. That summer, the Thames, coursing with the citys raw sewage, made life intolerable for residents, including members of Parliament, who worked right beside the rivers stench.

title: A Lack of Resilience
description: To the Editor:

title: College Legacy Admissions: Affirmative Action for Whites
description: To the Editor:

title: Joint Taliban-ISIS Attack Kills Dozens, Afghan Officials Say
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Dozens of civilians and militia forces were killed in northern Afghanistan in what officials on Sunday described as an attack by Taliban fighters teamed up with a commander claiming allegiance to the Islamic State. If true, the open cooperation between the militant groups, which have sometimes fought turf battles in the past, could be further trouble for the struggling Afghan government.

title: North Korea, Venezuela, Australia: Your Monday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: In a Corporate Concert World, an Indie Thrives in Washington
description: WASHINGTON  On a recent tour of the Anthem, his $60 million concert hall under construction, Seth Hurwitz excitedly pointed out the rooms features as they took shape. A movable stage. Angled balconies. An outside terrace with a striking waterfront vista.

title: Mark White, Texas Governor Who Championed Public Education, Dies at 77
description: Mark White, who as governor of Texas from 1983 to 1987 championed public education laws that limited class sizes, increased teachers pay and introduced basic skills tests for high school students, died on Saturday in Houston. He was 77.

title: Weaning Itself From Elephant Ivory, China Turns to Mammoths
description: NANJING, China  Environmentalists worried about the fate of Africas dwindling elephant population cheered when China announced a ban on the sale of commercial ivory last year, but an increasingly popular substitute is raising concerns of its own.

title: Heng on Democracy in Pakistan
description: Nawaz Sharif, Pakistans prime minister, was ousted from office by the Supreme Court over corruption charges, in what appeared to be a fair move. The court sidestepped other officials implicated in the Panama Papers leak that initiated the investigation, leading to accusations that it was pursuing selective justice. The military had cut Sharifs two previous terms.

title: Reading, Writing and Refugees
description: Here is a guide to some of the new and forthcoming childrens books about Muslim refugees, ranging from picture books for toddlers and early readers to young adult novels.

title: Childrens Authors Take On the Refugee Crisis
description: Some of the most shocking images from the crisis in Syria have been photographs of children: the body of a drowned toddler lying on a Turkish beach, the expressionless 5-year-old boy from Aleppo, shellshocked, bloodied and ash-covered, after being pulled from the rubble of a bombed building.

title: Ty Hardin, Star of Bronco Western, Dies at 87
description: Ty Hardin, who roamed the West searching for adventure in the television series Bronco in the late 1950s and early 60s, died on Thursday in Huntington Beach, Calif. He was 87.

title: Where Dancers Shine Beyond Their Usual Specialties
description: VAIL, Colo.  Since the two galalike signature events of the annual Vail Dance Festival were star-studded, its tempting to survey them just by dropping names. After all, on Friday here, Misty Copeland (never more mettlesome) and Marcelo Gomes (richly smoldering) danced Twyla Tharps Sinatra Suite, followed by Misa Kuranaga (lightly brilliant) and Herman Cornejo (panache itself) in the war horse Don Quixote pas de deux.

title: Cindy Sherman Takes Selfies (as Only She Could) on Instagram
description: Media hacks have Twitter, excitable teenagers have Snapchat and middle managers have LinkedIn, but in the art world, the social network of choice remains Instagram, where all the worlds beauty is gridded into squares.

title: A Late Outburst Propels the Yankees Over the Indians
description: CLEVELAND  On the occasions when Yankees Manager Joe Girardi calls players into his office, he treats those conversations like privileged communications. No amount of prying or prodding from reporters will prompt him to reveal details of what took place.

title: Reporters Not Being Pursued in Leak Investigations, Justice Dept. Says
description: WASHINGTON  Rod J. Rosenstein, the deputy attorney general, said on Sunday that the Justice Department was not pursuing reporters as part of its growing number of leak investigations, just two days after he and other department officials had appeared to signal a harsher line toward journalists.

title: Ordering a Marble Rye
description: Dear Diary:

title: What Card Dealers Deal
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  If yesterdays ship-themed puzzle by Patrick Berry had you at sea, todays gentle week-opener by Kevin Christian will restore your solving self-esteem.

title: Take the Generic, Patients Are Told. Until They Are Not.
description: This article was written through collaboration between The New York Times and ProPublica, the independent, nonprofit investigative journalism organization.

title: U.S. Troops Train in Eastern Europe to Echoes of the Cold War
description: NOVO SELO TRAINING RANGE, Bulgaria  After more than a decade spent fighting Islamic insurgents in Iraq and Afghanistan, the United States Army is scrambling to relearn Cold War-era skills to confront potential threats from Russia here in Eastern Europe, territory formerly defended by the Soviet Army.

title: State Senate Leader John Flanagan Sought Help for Alcohol Problem
description: ALBANY  The Republican leader of the State Senate, John J. Flanagan, announced on Sunday that he had sought help for an alcohol problem after realizing that drinking was becoming a crutch to deal with pressure I was under related to my responsibilities as majority leader.

title: Rwanda Presidents Lopsided Re-election Is Seen as a Sign of Oppression
description: KIGALI, Rwanda  The re-election of Paul Kagame, Rwandas longtime president, had never been in question. But opponents and rights advocates say his nearly 99 percent margin of victory reflects what they call an oppressive political environment that stifles dissent in the central African nation.

title: Fox News Suspends Eric Bolling After Report of Lewd Text Messages
description: Fox News suspended Eric Bolling, a longtime host at the network, on Saturday pending an investigation into reports that he sent lewd photographs to three female colleagues via text message.

title: As Netanyahu Investigators Close In, Some Ask: How Long Can He Hold On?
description: JERUSALEM  Political cartoons depict flames licking at the foundations of the fortresslike household of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu. Commentators say the noose is tightening around his neck.

title: Global News Quiz: Trump on the Telephone, Vote in Venezuela, Royal Retirement
description: Did you stay on top of the most important stories last week? Test your knowledge of international events with our quick quiz, recapping major news headlines and featured articles from across the globe. To take the quiz, click on an answer, and the correct response will be revealed after you choose.

title: No Corrections: August 7, 2017
description: No corrections appeared in print on Monday, August 7, 2017.

title: As Kenyas Vote Nears, Fear That Fake News May Fuel Real Bloodshed
description: ELDORET, Kenya  Fake news. Odd plot twists. Tit-for-tat accusations. One candidate calling another crooked.

description: LONDON  Tears, so many tears, in sports.

title: Thousands of Yemeni Forces Target Qaeda Stronghold
description: AL MUKALLA, Yemen  Thousands of Yemeni troops are conducting a clearing operation aimed at driving Qaeda militants from one of their major strongholds in southern Yemen, according to Arab and American security officials.

title: War-Crimes Prosecutor, Frustrated at U.N. Inaction, Quits Panel on Syria
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  For six years, an independent United Nations-appointed panel has documented a litany of war atrocities in Syria that have grown increasingly brazen: torture of prisoners, attacks on hospitals, sexual slavery.

title: Sprint, Looking to Get Bigger to Survive, Weighs Deal-Making
description: Masayoshi Son, the Japanese telecommunications mogul, has always been known as an inveterate deal maker. But amid a breakneck spree of investing in start-ups, Mr. Sons most anticipated moves will likely involve an old-line phone service provider: Sprint.

title: Oil Nations Look to Enforce Production Cuts, and Disney Earnings Are Coming
description: Heres a look at whats coming up this week.

title: Hideki Matsuyama Ties a Course Record to Win the Bridgestone Invitational
description: AKRON, Ohio  As Hideki Matsuyama warmed up Sunday afternoon at the Bridgestone Invitational, his tee shots raised the question: Was that a golf club in his hands or a pellet gun? The way he was spraying balls on the range, Matsuyama figured to struggle to break par.

title: Trying to Make America a Little Better
description: One of the few practical job-building promises of the Trump presidential campaign  a $1 trillion investment in repairing the nations crumbling infrastructure  is turning out to be as hollow as a pothole. Mr. Trumps vow to push for passage of the plan in the first 100 days of his presidency is sliding off the calendar amid the daily chaos of his incumbency and the Republican obsession with crippling Obamacare.

title: Jack Rabinovitch, Founder of Canadian Literary Award, Dies at 87
description: Jack Rabinovitch, founder of the pre-eminent prize in Canada for English-language literature, died on Sunday in Toronto. He was 87.

title: Cuomo to Give Colleges $7 Million for Courses in Prisons
description: ALBANY  Moving ahead with a plan that has drawn criticism from conservatives, the administration of Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo is awarding more than $7 million in grants to a variety of colleges around the state to offer courses to prisoners.

title: Quotation of the Day: U.S. Army Dusts Off Cold War-Era Playbook
description: Hes going to be around for a long time. Hes coup-proof.

title: Amid Talk of a 2020 Run, Cuomo Must First Deal With 2018
description: ALBANY  There was a time  call it March  when Gov. Andrew M. Cuomos plans for re-election next year seemed almost an afterthought.

title: Twin Peaks Season 3, Episode 13: Starting Position
description: From the beginning, Twin Peaks has embedded a clue to unlocking the show in its title. David Lynch and Mark Frost are captivated by dualities, whether theyre giving their characters literal doppelgngers or theyre exploring the extremes of good and evil within humanity as a whole. Whats apparent on the surface counts for little in Twin Peaks. A homecoming queen from an upstanding family can turn out to be a drug addicted part-time prostitute, while her father can be a serial sex offender. Just because someone looks pleasantly familiar doesnt mean theyre okay. Everyone is split.

title: Betty Cuthbert, Australias Golden Girl of Track and Field, Dies at 79
description: Betty Cuthbert, Australias golden girl of track and field, revered for her Olympic gold-medal feats and then her long and spirited struggle against multiple sclerosis, has died in Western Australia. She was 79.

title: Game of Thrones Season 7, Episode 4: Daenerys Soars, Starks Endure
description: Youre gonna need a bigger ballista.

title: Dodgers Hold Mets to One Hit and Cap a Three-Game Sweep at Citi Field
description: The loudest ovation Sunday night at Citi Field, during the Mets game against the Los Angeles Dodgers, came in the middle of the fourth inning, when the actor Bryan Cranston was shown on the center-field video screen.

title: Beloit: A Small Wisconsin Town Seeks to Become a Tech Haven
description: Under the impulse of the billionaire Diane Hendricks, Beloit, a small industrial town in Wisconsin, is becoming an attractive location for tech start-ups.
