After a day spent writing computer code inside a lab run by the Department of Energy, he would take the stage at a local juke joint, playing what he calls punk-influenced bluegrass  Johnny Rotten crossed with Johnny Cash. But what he really wanted to do was combine his days and nights, and build machines that could make their own songs. My only goal in life was to mix A.I. and music, Mr. Eck said.

title: Fleeing Hardship, Then Pushed Into Sea, They Landed in a Country at War
description: KHOUBIA, Yemen  For more than 24 hours, they were forced to sit on the floor of a plastic boat as it lurched across the sea, forbidden to get up even if they needed to urinate or vomit. The dates they had brought to eat on the journey were taken. Near dawn, when their smuggler thought he saw the lights of a patrol boat, they were ordered to jump overboard.

title: Detroit Red Wings Denounce Use of Logo by White Nationalist Group
description: Among the Nazi and Confederate flags unfurled by white nationalists marching in Charlottesville, Va., over the weekend was an incongruous symbol: the logo of the Detroit Red Wings.

title: The Familiar Promise of Health and Happiness in a Bottle
description: IN 1838, Robert Collyer, a British-born medical student turned American mesmerist, described New York City as a place where much quackery abounds, where any one who has the impudence may leave his foreplane, or lapstone, or latherbrush, and become a Physician; where any unlettered biped who has sufficient cant and hypocrisy may become a Minister of the Gospel. A bit rich coming from a man who based his lifes work on animal magnetism and phrenology  the idea that the size and shape of a persons cranium was directly correlated to his intelligence and character  but in the aftermath of the Second Great Awakening, his diagnosis was sound.

title: When You Need Creativity to Strike, Make Way and Gear Up

title: Elegant Grinders for the Seasoning Set
description: For many years, I have used a sleek black Magnum pepper mill. Its efficient and easy to fill. Now Tom David  whose company, Unicorn, makes the Magnum and other styles in Nantucket, Mass.  has introduced a consumer version of his Pepperstick, a mill meant for waiters. Unlike the Pepperstick, which is designed to be carried in an apron and cannot stand on its own, the new Tablestick comes with a stand. It is sold in black, part of a set with a matching white salt grinder: Tablestick Salt and Pepper Grinders, $55.99, unicornmills.com.

title: Extra Spice Gives Ginger Beer a Refreshing Kick
description: The company that produces Bruce Cost Ginger Ale, BCGA Concept Corporation, has introduced an extra-spicy ginger beer called Brooklyn Crafted. It is refreshing on its own as well as in mixed drinks and cocktails. There are bits of ginger in the unfiltered drink. Two sugar-free versions are sweetened with Stevia: Brooklyn Crafted, $1.79 for 12 ounces, four for $6.99, at Gourmet Garage stores and a pack of 12 for $24.75 at taldepot.com.

title: Alexander Zverev Rises to No. 7 While Playing Best Tennis of My Life
description: MONTREAL  In a mens tennis season dominated by the ageless veterans Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal, the Rogers Cup in Montreal last week served as a sort of coming out party for the next generation of tennis stars.

title: Duck and Wild Boar Salami for Summer Picnics
description: Saucisson sec, an air-cured French-style salami, is conveniently snackable. Now DArtagnan, which has been making a meaty, garlicky and slightly chewy heritage pork version for some time, has added two more varieties. The duck is tangy, spicy and somewhat soft. The wild boar is richly earthy and my favorite of the three. All are shelf-stable, making them ideal for picnics: Saucisson sec, $10.99 for 6 ounces for duck and wild boar, $9.99 for pork, dartagnan.com.

title: High-Wire Feat for Single-Stem Flowers
description: At an alfresco dinner on the edge of Lake Montauk last month, one long table was decorated with a charming and unusual floral arrangement. Individual blossoms hung upside-down from a wire strung over the table. I wanted to do something different and fresh, said Kelsie Hayes, the florist. It gives a floating effect. She uses 100-pound fishing line to run a single strand horizontally over the table, between posts mounted at both ends. At home, the fishing line could be pinned to a wall, posts, lights or other vertical fixtures. Then she uses a lighter line, 25 pounds, to tie to individual stems with double knots and hang them from the crosswire. Thats it: Popup Florist, Gansevoort Market, 353 West 14th Street (Ninth Avenue), thepopupflorist.com.

title: Wells Fargo Shows Erosion of Corporate Accountability Under Trump
description: There is an adage that its better to ask forgiveness than it is to get permission. title: C.E.O.s React After Trump Attacks Merck Chief

Frazier, chief executive of Merck, the pharmaceuticals company, on Monday resigned from President Trumps American Manufacturing Council after the president failed to directly condemn the white nationalist protesters at the center of violent protests in Charlottesville, Va., over the weekend.

title: A Luxurious Menu of Korean Desserts
description: Eunji Lee, the pastry chef at Jungsik, has taken an approach that is at once delectable and intelligent to her dessert tasting menu at the Korean restaurant in TriBeCa. The courses progress from light to rich, starting with a tart granita of omija (magnolia berry) with lemon-basil sorbet. A bright, cream-filled strawberry tart is followed by a lifelike banana made of white chocolate and ice cream. The brown-rice cream puff with ice cream and pecan praline is sheer indulgence. A black truffle ice cream cone is an optional extra ($25). The menu is served at the bar only; dessert libations are available to sip alongside: Dessert tasting menu, $55 ($35 extra for wine pairings), Jungsik, 2 Harrison Street (Hudson Street), 212-219-0900, jungsik.com.

title: Shoegaze, the Sound of Protest Shrouded in Guitar Fuzz, Returns

Two months later, a wash of more muscular fuzz made its way up through the tiers of Terminal 5 as Ride took the stage at that Manhattan club. Both bands formed in England in the late 1980s, achieved critical acclaim in the 1990s, reunited in 2014 and released new albums in the past few months that have reverberated on both sides of the Atlantic.

title: How to Talk to Your Kids About Charlottesville
description: Always look for the helpers. This quote from Fred Rogers, the beloved television personality, reflects his mothers advice that he always seek out those trying to help after a tragedy; the helpers were, he said, a sign of hope. But a threat by President Trump to use the American military against Mr. Maduros government has united those leaders in a different direction: demanding that the United States keep out of the regions affairs.

title: Costs for Foxs Harassment Settlements Rise to $50 Million
description: Twenty-First Century Fox said Monday that it had incurred about $50 million in costs during the year that ended June 30 tied to the settlement of sexual harassment and discrimination allegations in its Fox News division.

title: Producers of The Walking Dead Sue AMC Over Share of Profits
description: In a legal action that will be watched closely in Hollywood, several producers of The Walking Dead on Monday sued AMC  the cable network that presents the hit TV series  seeking a greater share of profits.

title: How Mr. Trump Could Face Up to White Supremacists
description: Theres a moral awakening taking place across America, but President Trump is still hiding under his blanket.

title: A Generation Driven to Win, but Practiced in Camaraderie
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  Justin Thomass birdie putt, the one that hung on the lip of the hole for a tick more than 10 seconds before dropping, encapsulated the patience that made his first major victory possible. But it was not the most indelible image from the 99th P.G.A. Championship.

title: Police Brace for More White Nationalist Rallies, but Have Few Options
description: After events in Charlottesville, Va., last weekend showed how much violence white nationalist rallies could provoke, police chiefs from Richmond, Va., to Boston were taking steps to avoid a repeat of a situation in which the police appeared to have little control of the crowd.

title: Far Right Plans Its Next Moves With a New Energy
description: The white supremacists and right-wing extremists who came together over the weekend in Charlottesville, Va., are now headed home, many of them ready and energized, they said, to set their sights on bigger prizes.

title: California Sues Justice Dept. Over Funding for Sanctuary Cities
description: Intensifying Californias standoff with the Trump administration over immigration policy, the California attorney general sued the Justice Department on Monday over the administrations plans to cut off millions of dollars in federal funding to so-called sanctuary cities unless they begin cooperating with federal immigration agents.

title: Quotation of the Day: Raging Floods and Mudslides Kill Hundreds in Capital of Sierra Leone
description: Our efforts is to look for more survivors, but so far all we see is dead bodies.

title: How the Violence Unfolded in Charlottesville
description: White nationalists and counterprotesters blamed one another and the police for the violence that erupted in Charlottesville, Va., on Saturday. Amateur video verified by The New York Times paints a picture of how the events led to one death and multiple injuries.

title: Collecting Collectors
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  Do you like to collect anything interesting? These days, my primary collection is college tuition invoices (does that make me a Bill collector?), but back when I had discretionary income, I used to collect anything that was designed during the Art Deco period. There is something about that design style that really appeals to me.

title: Corrections: August 15, 2017
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Protesters in Durham Topple a Confederate Monument
description: Chanting No K.K.K., no fascist U.S.A., the protesters slung a rope around the Confederate soldiers neck and pulled.

title: Canada Wants a New Nafta to Include Gender and Indigenous Rights
description: TORONTO  Canadas idea of a fair trade deal seems very different from President Trumps.

title: A Pair of Aarons, Judge and Hicks, Homer to Propel the Yankees Past the Mets
description: Back in March, when so little was known about the rebuilding Yankees, the primary competition taking place was in right field, where it was one Aaron versus another  Aaron Judge and Aaron Hicks.

title: Protesters Tear Down Confederate Statue in Durham
description: Days after clashes in Charlottesville, Va., protesters toppled a statue of a Confederate soldier that had stood in front of the old Durham County Courthouse in North Carolina for nearly a century.

title: The Great Crystal Boom of 2017
description: When Emily Satloff stops to hydrate during Pilates, she sips from a water bottle filled with rose quartz and amethyst. The goal? To add a dose of healing to her workout. I feel calmer while drinking from my crystal water bottle, said Ms. Satloff, the designer of the jewelry line Larkspur & Hawk.

title: Less Sleep Tied to Diabetes Risk in Children
description: Children who sleep less may be at increased risk for Type 2 diabetes, researchers report.

title: Ferraris and Opera Were Urgent, but Grenfell Tower Risks Went Unheeded
description: LONDON  The Ferraris were driving people batty in affluent South Kensington. Drivers revved their engines and ripped past Harrods. Residents were already irritated by the dust and noise from superrich neighbors building underground swimming pools and cinemas. Now came complaints about Middle Eastern types drag racing at night.

title: Donald Trump, Burkina Faso, Paris: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: North Korea Says It Will Wait a Little More Before Acting on Guam Threat
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea appeared on Tuesday to pause its threat to launch ballistic missiles toward Guam, saying it would wait to assess the foolish and stupid conduct of the United States before carrying the launchings out.

title: Whats on TV Tuesday: Iranian Vampires and Scientologists
description: Ana Lily Amirpour puts a Middle Eastern spin, with a touch of Italian westerns, on the Dracula tale. And Leah Remini returns with more tales of disillusioned Scientologists.

title: Word + Quiz: doggerel
Commuting Complications
Desperately Seeking Love Stories With a Temporal Twist
description: Dear Match Book,

title: Hong Kong Police Say Activist Faked Account of Kidnapping and Torture
description: HONG KONG  The police in Hong Kong said on Tuesday that a pro-democracy activist falsified his account last week of being abducted by men he said were mainland Chinese security officers who put staples in his legs.

title: Guam on Alert for North Korean Missile Test, but Residents Take It in Stride
description: INARAJAN, Guam  Against the back wall of the command center at Guam Homeland Security, a nondescript telephone is perched on a shelf. Its the phone no one in the room wants to hear ringing: It alerts Guam to an incoming ballistic missile.

title: Scarred by the Past, an Ex-Gang Member Aims for Revival
description: The tattoos inked onto the bodies and faces of former gang members in El Salvador make a new start nearly impossible. A photographer followed and documented one former gang member.

title: Trump, Obama and the Politics of Evasion
description: Regarding last weeks events in Charlottesville, Va., consider the following propositions:

title: How to Roll Back Fanaticism
description: Were living in an age of anxiety. The country is being transformed by complex forces like changing demographics and technological disruption. Many people live within a bewildering freedom, without institutions to trust, unattached to compelling religions and sources of meaning, uncertain about their own lives. Anxiety is not so much a fear of a specific thing but a fear of everything, an unnamable dread about the future. People will do anything to escape it.

title: Three Young Voices Versus a Superpower
description: Will Hong Kong jail its first political prisoners this Thursday? If it does  and it looks likely  the event will be a watershed in Hong Kongs modern history and should set off further alarms about Chinas intentions for the territory.

title: The Maddeningly Simple Way Tech Companies Can Employ More Women
description: I am the co-founder of a company that helps clients find ways to diversify their work force. We recently set up an interview at a major company for a senior African-American woman software engineer. After meeting with the hiring panel, she withdrew her application, telling us she felt demeaned by the all-white male group that failed to ask her any questions about her coding skills. She described how one of the men had made it clear to her that she wasnt a cultural fit and that therefore they didnt need to proceed with technical questions.

title: Chinas Intellectual Property Theft Must Stop
description: President Trump on Monday instructed the office of the United States Trade Representative to consider an investigation into Chinas sustained and widespread attacks on Americas intellectual property. This investigation will provide the evidence for holding China accountable for a decades-long assault on the intellectual property of the United States and its allies.

title: Summer of Love, Summer of War
description: In 1967, an ocean away from the escalating Vietnam War, the Summer of Love bloomed with psychedelic colors in San Franciscos Haight Ashbury neighborhood. Most of us remember the two events as distinct phenomena: One was a story of firebases, napalm, jungles and the draft; the other of communes, L.S.D., flowers and rock music. In fact, the two were inextricably linked.

title: When Families Lead Themselves Out of Poverty
description: Seventeen years ago, Mauricio Lim Miller, a leader in the field of social services, received a phone call from Jerry Brown, who was the mayor of Oakland, Calif., at the time, that set him on a quest to understand how families really overcome poverty. Lim Miller had spent decades working in community development, leading an organization, Asian Neighborhood Design, that had grown into a nationally recognized model. In 1999, Lim Miller was one of the honorees, along with Rosa Parks, invited by President Bill Clinton to attend the State of the Union address.

title: Teaching Activities for: A New Kind of Classroom: No Grades, No Failing, No Hurry
description: Before reading the article:

title: Scarred by the Past, an Ex-Gang Member Aims for Revival
description: The legacy of El Salvadors brutal civil war is etched on Ral Valladaress face in blue ink. Eighteen declares what he was, a member of one of El Salvadors feared maras, or gangs, whose ruthless violence still spurs many of his countrymen to seek safe haven in the United States. Yet once here, they cant really escape the violence, as we have seen with the spate of murders in Central American communities on Long Island in recent years.

title: How Nafta Changed U.S. Trade With Canada and Mexico
description: Trade has contributed to economic growth, but changing dynamics have also prompted concerns about lost jobs and the trade deficit. But when something is manufactured in the United States, it is often made up of parts from around the world.

title: On a Kuwaiti Island, Relics of the Gulf War
description: Step onto Failaka Island in the Persian Gulf, which was seized by Iraqi forces during the invasion of Kuwait. Bullet-riddled and abandoned buildings mark this remnant of the gulf war.

title: How to Make the Most of Free Hotel Amenities
description: Forget room service, spa treatments and other for-charge amenities available at most upscale hotels  these properties have plenty of free amenities that many guests dont take advantage of and may not even know about, said Lisa Holladay, the global brand leader for the Ritz-Carlton, St. Regis and Bulgari hotels.

title: The Rise of the Fidget Spinner and the Fall of the Well-Managed Fad
description: Earlier this year, when Christine Osborne first realized that fidget spinners  those small devices that have, seemingly overnight, colonized playgrounds and classrooms  were going to become a huge hit, she felt a deep anxiety. This was surprising, because Osborne owns multiple toy stores in South Carolina. Twenty years ago, she would have greeted a new fad like fidget spinners with glee. But the economy has changed quite a bit in the last two decades, and so when Osborne began first noticing the spinner craze, all she could think was: This seems like trouble.

title: What to Read Before You Head to Pittsburgh
description: Of the 10 plays August Wilson wrote  two of which won him the Pulitzer Prize  nine were based in and around the Hill District in Pittsburgh; he chronicled the citys changing landscape over decades. He is not the only writer to have chosen the Steel City as a backdrop. Below, one book explores the places that influenced Mr. Wilsons plays, and two others reimagine Pittsburghs people and culture.

title: America Is Struggling to Sort Out Where Violence Begins and Ends
description: When did our national discourse become so consumed with the state of our national discourse? Rarely has so much public dialogue been dedicated to arguing over what cant be said, who cant say it and just how they shouldnt put it. It has always been politically profitable to frame your opponents rhetoric as irrational, cruel, even dangerous. But our now-constant public skirmishes over speech have moved to another level entirely: These days, the closer you can situate your opponents words to actual violence, the better.

title: Why Was an Italian Graduate Student Tortured and Murdered in Egypt?
description: Leggere in Italiano

title: What Are Oceans Laws Trying to Protect?
description: A look at the warty sea cucumber, the California sea hare, the blue-banded goby and other creatures that dwell in waters near to areas with federal protections under review.

title: An Intellectual Historian Argues His Case Against Identity Politics
description: THE ONCE AND FUTURE LIBERAL After Identity Politics By Mark Lilla $24.99. 143 pp. Harper/HarperCollins Publishers.

title: An Art World Mystery Wrapped in the Story of a Young Woman Coming Unglued
description: IMPOSSIBLE VIEWS OF THE WORLD By Lucy Ives 296 pp. Penguin Press. $25.

title: One Theory Over Meaning of Trumps Many Sides Remark
description: WASHINGTON  Theories abound about why President Trump has repeatedly insisted that many sides are to blame for the white supremacist-fueled violence in Virginia over the weekend.

title: How the Radical Right Played the Long Game and Won
description: DEMOCRACY IN CHAINS The Deep History of the Radical Rights Stealth Plan for America By Nancy MacLean 334 pp. Viking. $28.

title: August Wilsons Pittsburgh
description: As soon as you emerge from the Fort Pitt Tunnel in Pittsburgh the citys impressive skyline appears, with the 44-story Art Deco Gulf Tower and the glassy, neo-Gothic PPG Place accentuating the view. Those two buildings tell the tale of the city. Once defined by its production of iron and steel, along with the ensuing smog, Pittsburgh now has self-driving cars being tested on its streets and rapid gentrification in many of its historically blue-collar neighborhoods.

title: Cue the Carrots! Strike Up the Squash!
description: On a muggy day in July, in a Long Island backyard, a group of musicians had gathered for rehearsal. As their conductor gently raised both hands, they steadied their instruments, and played the first notes of a Bach chorale, Nun freut euch, Gottes Kinder all.

title: One U.S. Factory Goes Global, While Trump Shrinks the World
description: LEXINGTON, Ky.  Never mind the refrain that the American factory is supposedly a dinosaur in the age of globalization.

title: Anthony Scaramucci Says Bannon Should Go, but Backs Up Trump
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. What do you think of it? What else are you interested in? Let us know: thearts@nytimes.com.

title: A Brief Conversation With Kit Harington About Jon Snow on Game of Thrones
description: Watching is The New York Timess TV and film recommendation newsletter and website. If youd like to receive this pop-up Game of Thrones newsletter straight to your inbox, sign up here. Read past newsletters on Episode 1, 2 and 3 and 4.

title: Australia Archbishop Rejects Sex-Abuse Exception to the Secrecy of Confession
description: Its confidential and considered sacred  a conversation strictly between a confessor and priest, never to be divulged. The secrecy of the confessional, a centuries-old sacrament, is taken so seriously that some priests would die before disclosing what has been shared.

title: The Daily: A Turning Point in Charlottesville
description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device: On iPhone or iPad | On Android via RadioPublic | Via Stitcher

title: Charlottesville, Stephen Bannon, Taylor Swift: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: The Obama-Trump Voters Are Real. Heres What They Think.
description: The story of the 2016 presidential election is simple. Donald J. Trump made huge gains among white voters without a college degree. His gains were large enough to cancel out considerable losses among well-educated white voters and a decade of demographic shifts.

title: Morning Agenda: Tallying the C.E.O. Desertion of Trump
description: By late Monday, in the immediate aftermath of the violence in Charlottesville, Va., the number of corporate chiefs serving as advisers to President Trump had shrunk by three. The question is, will more follow?

title: New York Today: Getting Around During Trumps Visit
description: Good morning on this tinted Tuesday.

title: Australian Government Accuses New Zealand of Trying to Undermine It
description: Among countries of the world, Australia and New Zealand are like siblings, with a shared colonial history and close trade, military and cultural ties. They even have a joint holiday to commemorate the sacrifices both nations made in World War I.

title: Key Questions on North Koreas Plan to Fire Missiles Near Guam
description: HONG KONG  North Korea has said it may fire missiles into waters near Guam, an American territory in the Western Pacific, escalating the standoff with the United States over the Norths nuclear program. Here are the questions raised by the threat.

title: Patricias of the Bronx: To Eat, or to Chat?
description: Patricia Borgognone stood near the door of her namesake Italian restaurant in the Morris Park section of the Bronx, welcoming customers. She embraced most of them as if they were dear friends, before ushering them into the packed, dimly lit dining room.

title: A Bit of Mischievous Fun at the Foot of Page One
description: A pattern hidden in plain sight.

title: Summer Reading Contest Winner, Week 7 | On I Dont Want to Watch Slavery Fan Fiction
description: Thank you to the 1033 teenagers who participated in the seventh  week of our 10-week Summer Reading Contest, and congratulations to Rebecca Cadenhead, our winner, as well as to our many runners-up and honorable mentions.

title: Diversity Initiatives Are Way Overdue, Academy President Says
description: LOS ANGELES  Last week, when the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences announced that John Bailey would serve as its next president, succeeding Cheryl Boone Isaacs, Hollywood scratched its head.

title: California Today: San Diegos Odd Couple
description: Good morning.

title: Claire Liu, a Rising Teenage Tennis Player, Reaches a Crossroad
description: LOS ANGELES  During a recent practice, Claire Liu sent an easy forehand sailing to the fence beyond the baseline and pressed a palm to her forehead.

title: Irans President Threatens to Restart Nuclear Program
description: TEHRAN  Irans nuclear program could be restarted in a matter of hours, if the American government imposes further sanctions on Tehran, the countrys president, Hassan Rouhani, said on Tuesday.

title: Trump Shares, Then Deletes, Twitter Post of Train Hitting Cartoon Person Covered by CNN Logo
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump shared on Twitter a cartoon on Tuesday morning of a train running over a person with a CNN logo covering the persons head, three days after a fatal collision in Charlottesville, Va. Mr. Trump deleted his retweet minutes later.

title: Its the Economy, Democrats, but Inequality Is Not the Issue
description: ASPEN, Colo.  Is income inequality the defining challenge of our time? Bernie Sanders thinks so. He ran for president as inequalitys most ardent foe. So does Elizabeth Warren, the other champion of the Democratic Partys left.

title: Walmarts C.E.O. Joins Group to Rebuke Trump Over Charlottesville
description: Walmarts chief executive has issued a strong rebuke of President Trumps response to the protests that turned violent in Charlottesville, Va., saying the president missed a critical opportunity to help bring our country together.

title: Regressing in London With Meat Loaf and Adrian Mole
description: LONDON  When the news you wake up to each morning has the menace of a Rottweilers growl  with unending stories of civil strife and looming nuclear cataclysm  it is understandable if you feel the urge to retreat. Or to regress, to return to a more innocent time, or  to be exact  a more innocent age.

title: South Koreas Leader Bluntly Warns U.S. Against Striking North
description: SEOUL, South Korea  With his public alarmed by President Trumps recent threats to North Korea, President Moon Jae-in of South Korea issued an unusually blunt rebuke to the United States on Tuesday, warning that any unilateral military action against the North over its nuclear weapons program would be intolerable.

title: Hamilton Tries New Sales Method to Battle Bots and Scalpers
description: Hamilton, the hit musical that has struggled to combat profiteering by scalpers, is trying a new tack with its next block of Broadway tickets: a technology from Ticketmaster that scrutinizes the purchase histories of potential ticket buyers in an effort to eliminate bots and high-volume resellers.

title: Hartford, With Its Finances in Disarray, Veers Toward Bankruptcy
description: HARTFORD  By many measures, Connecticut appears to be brimming with wealth. The state is known for its Gold Coast, populated with chief executives and hedge fund billionaires and specked with mansions on spacious estates. Then there are the suburbs that draw families with placid neighborhoods and high-achieving public schools.

title: The Last Days of Wicker
description: An air of fustiness hovers over the very words wicker furniture: One imagines sepia-toned photos of peacock-backed chairs on verandas in colonial India, and ornately curved chaises in Victorian conservatories. And indeed, the style is old  while wickers apex was in the 19th century, when trade routes from Asia brought a steady supply of rattan to Europe, the art of weaving objects from natural fibers actually goes back at least as far as ancient Egypt.

title: Pinpointing Your Whereabouts on Twitter
description: Q. If I have my phones location setting turned on and I post a picture from my house on Twitter, can people get my address from the coordinates in the photo data?

title: Tenants Sue Kushner Companies Claiming Rent Rule Violations
description: A group of New York City tenants has sued the Kushner Companies, the family real estate firm of Jared Kushner, President Trumps son-in-law and White House adviser, accusing the company of systematically violating the states rent regulations.

title: When Russia Owned Part of America
description: Mikhail Malakhov has been to the North Pole 31 times, he says, following in the footsteps of generations of Russian explorers.

title: Galicias Wild Horse Roundup Runs Headlong Into Modernity
description: OIA, Spain  Since medieval times, the people of Galicia have ritually rounded up the horses that roam wild in the green forests and hills of northwestern Spain.

title: London Inferno Inquiry Will Scrutinize How Officials Dealt With Complaints of Fire Risk
description: LONDON  A British government inquiry into the deadly inferno at a London high-rise for working-class tenants will examine the conduct of the local authorities, but not the broader issues involving low-income housing, the government said on Tuesday.

title: If Trump Stops Funding Key Health Care Subsidies, the Federal Government Will Actually Pay More
description: A newly released report says that the move would cause higher premiums and a larger federal deficit.

title: Police Add Civilians in Bid to Better Analyze Crime Data
description: For all the technological sophistication of the New York Police Department, in some respects it remains a collection of bureaucratic fiefs: 77 police precincts, their borders dating back decades, run by commanders who answer for crime within those lines.

title: Casual French Cafe Opens on Upper East Side
description: Philippe Delgrange, who owns Le Bilboquet on the Upper East Side, is putting the finishing touches on a new cafe a few doors east of his bistro. Caf Bilboquet offers breakfast pastries, fancier sweets like clairs, and ready-made panini and salads, along with coffee, tea, beer and, soon, wine in an elegantly gilded setting with plush garnet banquettes. A more complete menu will arrive in September: Caf Bilboquet, 26 East 60th Street (between Park and Madison Avenues), 646-869-8660, no website.

title: Swastikas, Shields and Flags: Branding Hate in Charlottesville
description: We decode the symbols of hate that white supremacists, Nazis and alt-right groups display at their marches, including the violent gathering in Charlottesville, Va.

title: Milton Mollen, 97, Dies; Investigated Police Corruption in New York
description: Milton Mollen, who led a commission that found that the New York City Police Department had been willfully blind to drug-related corruption by organized bands of rogue officers in the 1980s and early 90s, died on Monday at his home in Manhattan. He was 97.

title: Sometimes Its Hard to Accept That the Kids Are All Right
description: This column is an edited excerpt from the Dear Sugars podcast, an advice program hosted by Steve Almond and Cheryl Strayed. The audio contains an extended conversation and more letters; submissions are welcome at dearsugars@nytimes.com. If youre reading this on desktop, click the play button below to listen. Mobile readers can find Dear Sugars on the Podcasts app (iPhone and iPad) or Radio Public (Android and tablet).

title: Made Nice
description: Fast food from the chef Daniel Humm and his frequent collaborator, Will Guidara.

title: Made Nice Is Fast and Casual. But Is It Good?
description: New Yorkers will have more idle hours on their hands, or at least more time to watch otter videos at work, if Made Nice turns out to be the future of dining in New York.

title: Tree Topples in Central Park, Injuring Mother and 3 Children
description: A mother and her three children were injured in Central Park on Tuesday morning when an American elm tree toppled, pinning the woman beneath its branches before a group of Samaritans pulled her out, according to the police and witnesses.

title: Maria Sharapova Granted Wild Card Into U.S. Open Field
description: MASON, Ohio  The United States Tennis Association has awarded Maria Sharapova a wild card to enter the main draw of this years United States Open, which will be her first Grand Slam tournament since serving a 15-month suspension for doping.

title: Trailer: The Wound
description: A preview of the film.

title: Review: Boys Become Men in the Unsettling The Wound
description: Young men and their elders together experiencing the rigors of the wilderness is a kind of rite all over the world. It can be a time of self-discovery and liberation. In The Wound, a group of South African teenagers and their adult caretakers gather in a camp near mountains to observe a Xhosa ritual. The young men, called novitiates, are circumcised, and spend multiple weeks in the camp healing under supervision of the adults, who themselves underwent the procedure years before.

title: Three TV Shows to Watch This Week
description: Watching is The New York Timess TV and film recommendation newsletter and website.

title: Broadway Revival of Children of a Lesser God to Open in April
description: Children of a Lesser God, the 1980 drama about the relationship between a deaf cleaning woman and a hearing teacher, will be revived on Broadway next spring, the producers announced on Tuesday.

title: Home and Work: Maison Van Gend
description: The jewelry designer Raphael Van Gend says, To me, an absence of things is peaceful. You can tell by the way he decorated his Brussels home.

title: A Home So Uncluttered That It Almost Looks Empty
description: IN THE HANDS of Raphal Van Gend, almost anything is possible. At 43, the Belgian-born designer has been a ballet dancer (he trained at Academy Saussin); a painter (he studied at the Brussels Royal Academy of Fine Arts); and a fashion model in New York City in the mid-90s. In 2000, Van Gend returned to Europe and opened a creative agency in Paris, representing photographers like Matthieu Salvaing and fashion designers such as Charles Anastase. On the side, he studied the spiritual philosophy of Jiddu Krishnamurti and produced electronic music albums. Im always searching, thats my way. Its very touche--tout, which, Van Gend explains, is French for someone who dabbles. I work intuitively but that means I dont always know where Im headed.

title: Jamie Foxx, Alicia Keys and Justin Timberlake Perform at Apollo Theater Party
description: On Saturday celebrities and plutocrats arrived at Ronald Perelmans East Hampton estate for an annual benefit for the Apollo Theater.

title: When Jack Daniels Failed to Honor a Slave, an Author Rewrote History
description: LYNCHBURG, Tenn.  Fawn Weaver was on vacation in Singapore last summer when she first read about Nearest Green, the Tennessee slave who taught Jack Daniel how to make whiskey.

title: Sola Pasta Bar, From a Michelin-Starred Chef, Opens in SoHo
description: SOLA PASTA BAR Four years ago, Massimo Sola saw a chef tossing pasta and sauce in a wok, and immediately he understood how effective the Chinese cooking utensil could be for the task. So now, at his pasta restaurant in SoHo, hes using woks. There are five of them set into electric burners in the square kitchen that occupies most of the space, where chefs prepare pasta dishes in full view. The chefs do the cooking and serving, said Mr. Sola, who received a Michelin star in Varese, Italy. They can explain and interact with the customers. Mr. Solas menu features eight pastas, mostly familiar ones like penne allarrabbiata, linguine with clams, fettuccine Bolognese and tagliatelle with porcini. A few salads, antipasti and desserts are also served. There are 16 seats at the kitchen counter, another 10 at a communal table to one side and 44 at banquette tables along one wall. (Opens Wednesday): 330 West Broadway (Grand Street), 646-692-4131, chefsola.com.

title: The Business Leaders Who Were on Trumps Advisory Councils
description: There was a mass exodus of executives from presidential advisory councils as they opposed stances taken by President Trump.

title: Tillerson Condemns the Islamic State for Religious Persecution
description: WASHINGTON  The Trump administration criticized the Islamic State on Tuesday for its persecution of religious minorities but made no mention of a recent rise in attacks against Muslims in the United States, as it released the governments annual accounting of religious persecution around the world.

title: Solar Developers and Panel Makers Clash Over Tariff Request
description: WASHINGTON  Dozens of solar industry executives, government officials and foreign diplomats gathered here on Tuesday to urge federal trade commissioners to reject a petition from two troubled domestic solar equipment manufacturers to impose steep tariffs and minimum price guarantees on similar imports.

title: A Big Bill After Visiting the E.R.?
description: To the Editor:

title: New People Riffs on Race and Love, With a Twist
description: NEW PEOPLEBy Danzy Senna229 pages. Riverhead Books. $26.

title: Justice Dept. Demands Data on Visitors to Anti-Trump Website, Sparking Fight
description: WASHINGTON  The Justice Department is trying to force an internet hosting company to turn over information about everyone who visited a website used to organize protests during President Trumps inauguration, setting off a new fight over surveillance and privacy limits.

title: Holocaust Memorial in Boston Is Vandalized for Second Time This Summer
description: A Massachusetts teenager has been charged with vandalizing a Holocaust memorial in Boston, in what the citys police commissioner called a senseless and shameful act, particularly after the neo-Nazi rally in Charlottesville, Va.

title: 1 in 7 New York City Elementary Students Will Be Homeless, Report Says
description: There were 100,000 homeless students in New York City public schools during the 2015-16 school year, a number equal to the population of Albany.

title: Tom Ford, Where the Rich and Famous Go to Look Rich and Famous
description: Behind a kidney-shaped black desk with an expensive floral arrangement, a blond concierge with a ready smile waits to wish you a good afternoon. You are on Madison Avenue and 61st Street, a prime location and expensive real estate, so you may be entering a high-end hotel or an architecture firm, but in fact this is Tom Ford, a master of opulent ambience if ever there was one, for whom black tie is the best tie and no courtesy need be scrapped.

title: Read the C.B.O.s Report
description: The nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office on Tuesday released its findings on the effects of eliminating payments for cost-sharing reductions under the Affordable Care Act.

title: Trump Threat to Obamacare Would Send Premiums and Deficits Higher
description: WASHINGTON  Premiums for the most popular health insurance plans would shoot up 20 percent next year, and federal budget deficits would increase by $194 billion in the coming decade, if President Trump carried out his threat to end certain subsidies paid to insurance companies under the Affordable Care Act, the Congressional Budget Office said Tuesday.

title: Costco Owes Tiffany More Than $19 Million, Judge Rules
description: Theres no place like Tiffany, the famous jeweler says on its website  and that includes Costco.

title: U.S.C. Expands in a Neglected Neighborhood, Promising Jobs and More
description: LOS ANGELES  When the University of Southern Californias campus extension opens in South Los Angeles on Thursday, it will not just welcome 2,700 new college students. It will also be an ambitious test of a public-private partnership hoping to remake a historically underserved neighborhood.

title: Uber Agrees to Privacy Audits in Settlement With F.T.C.
description: WASHINGTON  Uber has agreed to two decades of privacy and security audits to settle federal accusations that it did not keep promises to protect customer data.

title: Harriet Beecher Stowe House Is for Sale Online

title: Amazing Photographs From Mario Testinos Personal Collection
description: Easy is boring! says the photographer Mario Testino, discussing his approach to buying art. Sometimes I saw a work and didnt like it. But then Id ask myself why and come back to it. Some of the works that I had problems with are now my favorites. Testino began collecting photography in the early 1980s  his first purchase was a portrait of the actress Vivien Leigh by the Surrealist photographer Angus McBean. Since then, he has amassed a formidable collection of contemporary photography that is unexpectedly subversive given the over-the-top glamour of Testinos own subjects (Not all my images are so glamorous! he demurs). Part of his collection will be auctioned online at Sothebys from Sept. 1-15 to benefit Museo Mate in Lima, Peru, a nonprofit established by Testino in 2012. Above are our favorite images from the sale.

title: This Was the Alt-Rights Favorite Chat App. Then Came Charlottesville.

They organized last weekends Unite the Right rally in Charlottesville, Va., connecting several major white supremacy groups for an intimidating display of force. And when that rally turned deadly, with the killing of a 32-year-old counterdemonstrator, they cheered and discussed holding a gathering at the womans funeral.

title: Still Processing: Anguish and Anger Over Charlottesville
description: Expressions of white supremacy in this country arent new. But what happened in Charlottesville, Va., over the weekend was the largest public melee during a presidential administration that includes men with white nationalist ties. Three people were killed, dozens of people were injured and the country was thrown into a state of anguish and shock. The show was on vacation, but we came back early to talk about Charlottesville and why the violence there isnt surprising, what it means to remove totems of the American Confederacy and what a verbal apology from President Trump is really worth.

A North Carolina law passed in 2015 prohibits the removal of these monuments, yet the prospect of being prosecuted for doing just that was not a deterrent.

These prisoners are among the most poorly educated people in the country, and that fact holds the key to a solution. Decades of research has shown that inmates who participate in prison education programs  even if they fail to earn degrees  are far more likely to stay out of prison once they are freed.

title: A Changed Landscape for Abortion Rights in Texas

By the time Kristen passed the sign on her way to get an abortion, she had been riding a Greyhound bus for four hours. The 150-mile trip was the shortest distance she could travel to visit an open clinic  Whole Womans Health in San Antonio.

title: Mom Left Me the House. What Do I Owe My Brothers?
description: I am in my early 60s and have two older brothers. Three years ago, my mother died suddenly, and I inherited her home and all its contents. The day after she died, one of my brothers threatened to sue me for his share of the inheritance. I waited to breathe until probate was over. Six months later, my brothers sent a letter accusing me of theft, coercion, emotional blackmail, mismanaging my mothers funds and using my ill health as a way to bilk her of money. A lawyer friend told me to ignore their threats and to tell them I would honor her will. My mothers lawyer, who drew up the will, agreed with that advice.

Born and raised in nearby Monroe, she moved to this hamlet in the town of Blooming Grove with her husband in 1978. The couple paid about $30,000 for a 1909 stone Arts and Crafts-style cottage built by a blacksmith. description: The sperm count of men in Western countries has been declining precipitously with no signs of leveling off, according to new research, bolstering a school of thought that male health in the modern world is at risk, possibly threatening fertility.

title: Tom Stoppards Travesties Will Return to Broadway
description: Tom Stoppards Travesties, which was nominated for best revival at the Olivier Awards in London this year, will transfer to Broadway in 2018.

title: California Today: Hamilton Sweeps Through the State
description: Good morning.

title: Looming War Games Alarm North Korea, but May Be a Bargaining Chip
description: TOKYO  Twice a year, American and South Korean troops get together for large-scale war games to prepare for a possible attack by North Korea. And year after year, the North condemns the joint exercises as a rehearsal for an invasion and demands that they be called off.

title: New Analysis Detects Objects Near Suspected MH370 Plane Crash Site
description: HONG KONG  Australia said on Wednesday that 12 objects that floated in 2014 near the suspected crash site of Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 were probably man-made, according to a new analysis of satellite images, adding a fresh wrinkle to one of the worlds great aviation mysteries.

title: What You Get for $650,000
description: A 1770 house in Norfolk, Conn.; a renovated bungalow in Raleigh, N.C.; and a 1928 Tudor-style house in Dallas.

title: $650,000 Homes in Connecticut, North Carolina and Texas
description: WHAT A 1770 house with three bedrooms and two bathrooms

title: House Hunting in ... Toronto
description: A renovated Victorian is for sale for $4.65 million in Oakville, a suburb of Toronto.

title: House Hunting in ... Toronto
description: A RENOVATED VICTORIAN NEAR TORONTO

title: Obamas Charlottesville Response, Boosted by Nostalgia, Becomes Most-Liked Tweet Ever
description: Barack Obamas response to the violence in Charlottesville, Va., became the most-liked tweet in Twitters history Tuesday night, according to representatives for the social media platform.

title: Tribeca Film Festival to Start Standalone TV Gathering
description: Over the past few years the Tribeca Film Festival has strayed from its titular mission further into television, with events focused on cultural lightning rods like The Handmaids Tale and Girls. Now the team behind the festival is creating a separate event devoted solely to television, to be called (naturally) the Tribeca TV Festival.

title: Found: Oldest Known Photo of a U.S. President (Socks and All)
description: Count John Quincy Adams among those who could be grumpy about having their picture taken.

title: Getting Microsoft Word to Call You by Your Real Name
description: Q. To activate Microsoft Word on my new laptop, I had to open a Microsoft account, but I didnt use my real name. Now, when I edit a document in Word and add a comment, it lists the note under that made-up name. Any way I can get it to switch back to my real name?

title: A Chinese Video Game Rakes In Cash  and Draws Young Rule Breakers
description: SHANGHAI  In China, teenagers can purchase a fake ID online for as little as $2. Is it for buying booze? Subverting the state? Many simply want to play a game on their phones.

title: Fiat Chrysler Joins BMW in Race to Make Self-Driving Cars
description: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles will cooperate with BMW to develop self-driving cars, the companies said Wednesday, as traditional automakers look to defend their turf against cash-rich Silicon Valley giants eager to upend the industry.

title: The Rooms Where Writers Work
description: I moved to Chicago five years ago with basically nothing, my own fantasy of a life that fits in a suitcase. I like to reduce  Im a sentimental person but can throw things away very easily  and Im always aiming for a completely bare space in which to work. But then I tend to accumulate things, books and little trinkets. Its just as well because I need something to sort through before I get to work. I have to make and then remake my own mess. Its a constant opposition between chaos and order.

title: Giancarlo Stanton Is Chasing History With Home Run Binge
description: Giancarlo Stanton hit his 43rd home run on Monday, breaking the Marlins previous single-season record, set by Gary Sheffield in 1996. The praise poured in, and then baseball fans prepared to turn their attention elsewhere. But Stanton would not surrender the spotlight. He hit No. 44 on Tuesday, and he is now poised to chase some even bigger historic numbers.

title: Sculpture Laid Low
description: Increasingly, artists are installing flat works on the ground.

title: Why Are So Many Artists Making Work That Lies on the Floor?
description: During the summer of 1969, the Whitney Museum of American Art in New York organized a show of what it described as disordered art, much of it sculpture that was difficult to classify. In the exhibition, the post-Minimalist artist Lynda Benglis was meant to debut her work Contraband, a rainbow-colored pour of pigmented latex, alongside pieces by Richard Serra, Eva Hesse, Carl Andre and Rafael Ferrer. When the curators told her that the piece, which was designed to lie flat on the ground, was going to be positioned half on and half off a ramp, Benglis pulled out of the exhibition. Recently, I asked her why she had begun making these flat sculptures. When you see a curve and when you see things that flow on the floor, you physically feel them in a gravitational way, she said. Flat, I took her to mean, doesnt mean inert.

title: Taylor Swifts Priceless Dollar
description: Taylor Swift is one of the wealthiest self-made women in the world: The pop star has an estimated net worth of $280 million. But on Monday she was awarded a single dollar by the jury in her suit against a man who groped her  a sum more precious, especially to victims of sexual assault, than her pile of millions.

title: After Charlottesville Violence, Colleges Brace for More Clashes
description: After a planned speech in February by the right-wing writer Milo Yiannopoulos attracted demonstrators who started fires and shattered windows, the University of California, Berkeley realized it had a major hole in its event planning.

title: A Brutal Gang Assault, Two Skull Surgeries, and a Miraculous Recovery
The Whale That Should Not Have Gotten Away
description: The editorial board of The Wall Street Journal has asserted that bankers and traders didnt go to jail for their bad behavior in the years leading up to the financial crisis because they havent committed any crimes.

title: Republicans, This Is Your President
description: Back in the before-times, when all the polls predicted a landslide Hillary Clinton victory and establishment Republicans were pivoting away from Donald Trump like a chorus line, I had a postelection cautionary column in the hopper. It was imperative, I planned to write, that we remember who the Republicans were before Trump thundered in and tossed reality on its axis.

title: Embrace the Egg!
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here. Download the NYT Cooking app here.

title: Business Leaders Finally Walk Away From Mr. Trump
description: The decision to lend their credibility to the president became too hard to justify.

title: Trump on Taxes
description: Republicans often point to Ronald Reagans 1986 Tax Reform Act as the kind of ambitious rewriting of the tax laws that is possible with persistence, bipartisan cooperation and strong presidential leadership. Congressional Republicans headed to the Reagan Ranch in California on Wednesday to seek inspiration at a place sacred to the last president who accomplished a sweeping overhaul of the tax code.

title: Donald Trumps Hurricane Season
description: NEW ORLEANS  On Aug. 5, my wife got a series of frantic text messages from a friend who was watching her car fill with water. There was no hurricane, no tropical storm, but over eight inches of rain had fallen that afternoon, and the citys pumps couldnt keep up. Another friend had to abandon her car under a highway overpass and wade a mile across town, in the dark, to get home to her baby daughter. It was the second time in two weeks that parts of New Orleans flooded.

title: Right and Left React to Trumps Latest Charlottesville Comments Blaming Both Sides
description: The political news cycle is fast, and keeping up can be overwhelming. Trying to find differing perspectives worth your time is even harder. Thats why we have scoured the internet for political writing from the right and left that you might not have seen.

title: Theresa May Sharpens Her Response to Trumps Charlottesville Remarks
description: LONDON  Prime Minister Theresa May of Britain on Wednesday criticized the reaction of President Trump to the violence in Charlottesville, Va., after initially declining to condemn the American leaders stance.

title: Ex-Trump Aides Hunt for Untapped Voters, and Proof of Fraud
description: WASHINGTON  With President Trumps poll numbers slipping, a group of the presidents former campaign aides is beginning an effort to encourage new voters in parts of the country that supported him in the election, and to stop what they contend are illegal votes in Democratic areas.

title: Meet the Creator of Beyoncs Crown From the 7/11 Video
description: Enter Laura Wasss Brooklyn studio and you will find brass bunny ears, candy-colored bras, gold crowns and other pieces that are a futuristic cross between happy-go-lucky and streetwise, something a young Joan Jetson might have worn to an intergalactic rave.

title: The New Authority in Great Books to Read: Who You Follow on Instagram
description: In May, Picador Books sent a copy of an upcoming thriller, Christopher Yatess Grist Mill Road, to the actress Krysten Ritter. The publicity team was thrilled when Ritter, the star of the Netflix series Jessica Jones, agreed to blurb the book  and even more thrilled when, unprompted, she shared a picture of it with her 655,000 followers on Instagram. Theres a good chance her Instagram is going to help the book more than her blurb on the back cover, which will mostly be seen by people picking it up in a physical bookstore, says James Meader, Picadors executive director of publicity.

title: Roman Polanski Accused of Sexual Abuse by Another Woman
description: A third woman has come forward to accuse the film director Roman Polanski of sexual abuse when she was a minor.

title: F.B.I. Agents Supported Comey, Surveys Show, Weakening Trumps Claim of Turmoil
description: WASHINGTON  As F.B.I. director, James B. Comey had widespread support from his agents, according to internal survey data released Wednesday that contradicts President Trumps claim that he fired Mr. Comey in part because agents had lost confidence in him.

title: Russian Ex-Minister Accuses Putin Ally of Framing Him
description: MOSCOW  A former cabinet minister in Russia accused of accepting a $2 million bribe went on trial in Moscow on Wednesday, the highest-ranking official to be prosecuted in the country in decades.

title: Review: The Hitmans Bodyguard, With Samuel L. Jackson
description: Samuel L. Jackson is the hit man. Ryan Reynolds is the bodyguard. What more do you want me to say? These two sometime residents of different branches of the greater Marvel cosmos  Nick Fury and Deadpool, if you need reminding  join up, with ostentatious reluctance, on a European jaunt, leaving a trail of dead minions and flummoxed law enforcement officers from Manchester to The Hague. Their common nemesis is an Eastern European despot, a genocidal maniac with a scholarly mien and personal touch played, it seems almost redundant to point out, by Gary Oldman.

title: Political Migration: A New Business of Moving Out to Fit In
description: Paul Chabot, a Republican, ran in the fall for Congress from a part of Californias Inland Empire that was once reliably Republican. That was the best way, he figured, to revive a community he remembered from his childhood as being safer, more prosperous, with better public schools and less liberal politics. It was his final effort trying to make things work in California.

title: How Roy Moore Won Alabama
description: Mobile, Ala.  Former Alabama Chief Justice Roy Moore delivered a striking rebuke Tuesday to President Trump and the Senate majority leader, Mitch McConnell.

title: Inside the C.E.O. Rebellion Against Trumps Advisory Councils
description: On Tuesday, Indra Nooyi, the chief executive of PepsiCo, joined a call with other prominent corporate chieftains who  like her  had agreed to advise President Trump.

title: Lives of 18th Century British Troops Unfold in Upstate New York
description: FORT EDWARD, N.Y.  Stuart Sutton wasnt interested in a typical summer vacation, so he traded in suntan lotion and a towel for bug spray and a trowel.

title: Stream These Great Steven Soderbergh Titles
description: Steven Soderberghs new heist comedy Logan Lucky is his first feature directorial effort in over four years  but before that, he was one of cinemas most versatile and prolific filmmakers, regularly turning out a feature or more per year, in a wide array of genres and styles, from expensive studio star vehicles to microbudget indies featuring nonactors.

title: The African Migration Tragedy in Yemen
description: The narrow strait that separates the Horn of Africa from the Arabian Peninsula is so treacherous it is called Bab el Mandeb  gateway of grief. Its earned its miserable name lately as African migrants try to pass through war-torn Yemen to flee dire poverty and hunger and reach Saudi Arabia, and jobs.

title: For Stephen Adly Guirgis, the Long Road Back to a First Love: Acting
description: DORSET, Vt.  About a week before rehearsals started for David Mamets American Buffalo at the Dorset Theater Festival in southern Vermont, Stephen Adly Guirgis realized it was too late to make up an excuse and bail without causing major harm.

title: Once a Mystery Science Theater In-Joke, Now Playing Comedy Clubs
description: Show-business veterans and movie-trivia mavens, gather round. The mystery of Chief Zabu has been solved.

title: Marian C. Diamond, 90, Student of the Brain, Is Dead
description: Marian C. Diamond, a neuroscientist who overturned long-held beliefs by showing that environmental factors can change the structure of the brain and that the brain continues to develop throughout ones life, died on July 25 at her home in Oakland, Calif. She was 90.

title: Chinas Online Giants Back $12 Billion Deal to Shake Up State Firm
description: HONG KONG  Some of Chinas biggest technology players are backing a plan to invest nearly $12 billion in one of the countrys telecommunications giants, the latest move in a broader government push to shake up the countrys bloated state-run companies.

title: U.K. Sets Out Goals for an Open Irish Border. Trade Is More Complex.
description: LONDON  The militarized checkpoints that once stood along the border between Ireland and Northern Ireland became flash points for sectarian violence during the Troubles, and no one wants to see their return after Britain quits the European Union in 2019.

title: U.S. Begins Nafta Negotiations With Harsh Words
description: WASHINGTON  The renegotiation of the North American Free Trade Agreement is off to a rocky start.

title: Jewish Trump Staff Silent on His Defense of Rally With Anti-Semitic Marchers
description: WASHINGTON  Jewish members of President Trumps administration remained largely silent Wednesday after Mr. Trump came to the defense of nationalist and right-wing protesters in Charlottesville, Va., who had chanted anti-Semitic slogans and demeaned the presidents Jewish son-in-law.

title: Replace Ezekiel Elliott? The Cowboys Cant
description: Ezekiel Elliott, the star running back, will be lost to the Dallas Cowboys for the first six games of the season, barring a successful appeal of his suspension for domestic violence. So how do the Cowboys replace the N.F.L.s leading rusher?

title: Manchester Arena to Reopen After Terror Attack With Benefit Concert
description: The Manchester Arena, where a suicide bomber killed 22 people and injured more than 100 following an Ariana Grande concert in May, will officially reopen on Sept. 9 with a benefit show headlined by one of the citys premier exports, Noel Gallagher of Oasis.

title: Scott Glenn, Wielding Knives on a Screen Near You
description: The blade was dull, but Scott Glenns reflexes were alarmingly sharp.

title: The Technology Our Personal Finance Columnist Trusts His Money With
description: How do New York Times journalists use technology in their jobs and in their personal lives? Ron Lieber, The Timess Your Money columnist, discussed the tech hes using.

title: Next Door to War, an Indie Arab Band Sings of Defiance and Joy
description: EHDEN, Lebanon  Saturday night. The stage is pressed hard against a pine-covered hill. The stars are out. The crowd is shouting Leila.

title: Inspired by Love Birds in Their 90s
description: Last weeks Vows column Shes 98. Hes 94. They Met at the Gym., about how a nonagenarian couple became acquainted, courted and recently married, showing the world that love has no age barriers, inspired numerous comments on Facebook and Twitter. Many readers extended their congratulations and encouragement to the newlyweds, some shared their own experiences and opinions. Below are some of the highlights, edited for space.

title: Switzerland and Germany Unlikely Adversaries in Spy Drama
description: FRANKFURT  Tax collectors do not usually loom large in espionage thrillers, nor are Germany and Switzerland often portrayed as bitter adversaries in the spy game.

title: Watching Neo-Nazis in Virginia From a German Opera House
description: BAYREUTH, Germany  It was my first visit to the Bayreuth Festival, and I was wrestling with conflicting emotions. There was the thrill of realizing my long-held dream of hearing Richard Wagners music in the opera house he built, where some of my favorite recordings were made. But there was queasiness, too, at the inescapable memories of old photos showing the theater defiled during the Nazi era, festooned with swastikas and visited regularly by Hitler.

title: Prominent Opposition Leader in Iran Begins Hunger Strike
description: TEHRAN  One of Irans most prominent opposition leaders, under house arrest since 2011, was hospitalized early Thursday, a day after he began a hunger strike to demand a public trial, family members said.

title: Health Care in New York
description: To the Editor:

title: Fed Officials Confront New Reality: Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
description: WASHINGTON  Federal Reserve officials are struggling to make sense of a new economic reality in which low inflation and low unemployment are persisting side by side.

title: Homeless Hero of Manchester Attack Is Accused of Stealing From Victims
description: LONDON  He is known as a homeless hero.

title: An Enchanted Evening of Indian Dance Under a Turner Sky
description: Tuesday was the 70th anniversary of Indias independence; it was also the day of Lord Krishna. But rain had fallen all afternoon in New York; things looked inauspicious for the outdoor Erasing Borders Festival of Indian Dance event that evening. But fate turned the program, set beside the harbor in Lower Manhattan, into enchantment  even sublimity.

title: Richard Trumka: Why I Quit Trumps Business Council
description: On Tuesday, President Trump stood in the lobby of his tower on Fifth Avenue in Manhattan and again made excuses for bigotry and terrorism, effectively repudiating the remarks his staff wrote a day earlier in response to the white supremacist violence in Charlottesville, Va. I stood in that same lobby in January, fresh off a meeting with the new president-elect. Although I had endorsed Hillary Clinton for president, I was hopeful we could work together to bring some of his pro-worker campaign promises to fruition.

title: Comedian Sues Neo-Nazi Daily Stormer as Site Resurfaces From Dark Web
description: The comedian and writer Dean Obeidallah filed a defamation lawsuit against the neo-Nazi website The Daily Stormer on Wednesday, around the same time that the website briefly resurfaced from the dark web with a Russian domain name.

title: How TV News Reacted to Trumps Charlottesville Remarks
description: President Trumps news conference Tuesday left many TV personalities searching for ways to describe what they had just seen. Watch our roundup.

title: Review: Logan Lucky: Steven Soderbergh and His Motley Band of Thieves
description: In American movies  and maybe not only there  the idea of luck often functions as a euphemism for, and an antidote to, the effects of class. In a land of winners and losers, where life is acknowledged to be unfair and positive thinking is all-powerful, we often find fault (or solace) not in our social structures but in our stars.

title: Review: Grizzly Bear Staves Off Despair With Beauty on Painted Ruins
description: Theres a magnificent insularity in Grizzly Bears music on its fifth full-length album, Painted Ruins. The band shows the concentration of craftsmen who delight in intricacy and a willingness to sling strictly private allusions, expecting that listeners will engage with layers of convolution. Yet Grizzly Bear doesnt stint on more extroverted (if slightly old-fashioned) pleasures like curvaceous melodies, plush harmonies and sweeping buildups, along with glimpses of heartache and echoes of a more sumptuous, more optimistic pop past.

title: Review: Penlope Cruz Is Luminous in The Queen of Spain
description: The Queen of Spain, a light ensemble romp from the veteran director Fernando Trueba, has fun with movie lore even as it pillories Hollywoods deal-making with the Francisco Franco regime in the 1950s. (The film is a sequel to Mr. Truebas The Girl of Your Dreams, from 1998, about a Third Reich engagement with Spanish showbiz.) In Queen, an opening montage evoking newsreels describes Francos invitation to American studios to shoot in Spain.

title: N.F.L. and Players Union Trade Accusations in Ezekiel Elliott Case
description: The already contentious six-game suspension of Dallas Cowboys running back Ezekiel Elliott took on a new intensity on Wednesday when the N.F.L. and the N.F.L. Players Association traded angry accusations over information related to the case.

title: Using YouTube as an Accelerant for Video Games
description: When Dynamic Pixels, a small Russian game developer, decided to make a stealth horror video game about sneaking into an ominous neighbors house, it turned to the crowdfunding site Kickstarter. The campaign for the game  called Hello Neighbor  flopped, earning less than $13,000 of its $100,000 fund-raising goal.

title: Explosion Injures F.B.I. Agents Hand in Lower Manhattan
description: A special agent with the Federal Bureau of Investigation suffered a serious hand injury on Wednesday when a concussion grenade accidentally detonated as the agent was checking it in the back of a car at the bureaus headquarters in Lower Manhattan, several law enforcement officials said.

title: Kenya Opposition Leader Says Hell Expose Election Fraud
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  The leader of Kenyas opposition party said Wednesday he would challenge the results of last weeks presidential election in the Supreme Court, not in the hopes of overturning the outcome but as a way to expose evidence of widespread vote-rigging.

title: Lebanon Repeals Its Marry-Your-Rapist Law
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Lebanon on Wednesday repealed a law that allowed rapists to evade punishment by marrying their accusers, the latest in a string of countries in the region to reverse such provisions under pressure from Arab womens groups.

title: Hard Truths or Easy Targets? Confronting the Summer of Trump Onstage
description: Tycoon, television star, head of state and now  whod have thought?  leading man of the New York stage. Not that Donald J. Trump has been known for spending nights at the theater since he took the oath of office. But his alter egos, summoned by playmakers angered and bewildered by his election, have been myriad lately. As a consequence, American theater has insinuated its way into the national conversation in a way we havent seen in years.

title: Artists on the Battle Lines, From France (Where Else?)
description: The New York Times Mid-Week Pictorial exemplified how powerful a tool the camera had become in telling the story of war. But technical limitations still left a lot to be desired. There were many French artists who believed they had a role to play in conveying the wars terrors in ways that photographers could not.

title: Stream These Great Steven Soderbergh Movies
description: Logan Lucky is Steven Soderberghs first feature film in over four years  but before that, he was one of cinemas most versatile filmmakers.

title: Charlottesville, Guam, Alibaba: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Heather Heyers Mother Asks Mourners to Make It Count
description: Susan Bro, the mother of the woman killed in Charlottesville, Va., spoke at a memorial service on Wednesday and called on the audience to take action.

title: Heather Heyer, Charlottesville Victim, Cannot Be Silenced, Mother Says
description: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va.  Heather D. Heyer, the woman run down during violent clashes here, was remembered on Wednesday for a quality that friends and relatives described as her most frustrating, and most admired  a passion for fighting injustice that was so relentless, it often spilled into her work and personal life.

title: 5 Easy Ways to Take Your Wardrobe From Summer to Fall
description: Not only do the last days of summer tend to inspire ruminations on lifes more fleeting qualities, but they also present a challenge for those of us who sometimes cope with such dark realities at the stores. We crave the mood-boosting properties of a wear-it-right-now purchase  but not the needless expense of an item that wont wear well into fall. Luckily, the shops have a lot of enticing goods that tread the line between the two. On-trend purses and footwear,  new rectangular sunglasses, these transitional pieces impart freshness to your late-summer look, and will happily last all year long.

title: Free Speech and Assembly in Hong Kong
description: To the Editor:

title: Im Not Putting Anybody on a Moral Plane
description: When President Trump refused to unequivocally denounce white supremacists on Tuesday, he stepped away from what U.S. presidents have seen as crucial to their job: setting a moral course for the nation.

title: The New South Bronx
description: The area that gave rise to hip-hop being celebrated by a clutch of entrepreneurs, real estate developers and, inevitably, the fashion tribes.

title: Bubble Tea Purveyors Continue to Grow Along With Drinks Popularity
description: Editors note: An earlier version of this article prompted criticism by readers and we have since revised the article in response. We have discussed the concerns in further detail here.

title: A Weekend Can Span Centuries at Tanglewood
description: LENOX, Mass.  For most visitors, a weekend here at Tanglewood, the summer home of the Boston Symphony Orchestra, begins and ends in the Shed, where the standard symphonic literature is played from Friday through Sunday. But fuller, longer stays are also available at Seiji Ozawa Hall, sometimes leading to distant corners of the repertory.

title: Unlike His Predecessors, Trump Steps Back From a Moral Judgment
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump did more on Tuesday than simply draw an equivalence between the torch-wielding marchers and the leftist activists who clashed with them in Charlottesville, Va. He relinquished what presidents from Roosevelt to Reagan have regarded as a cardinal duty of their job: set a moral course to unify the nation.

title: The Rebranding of the Bronx
description: In the late 1980s, Bruckner Boulevard was a forbidding stretch of asphalt strung with disused factories, dim tattoo parlors and fast-food depots. The thoroughfare, blisteringly sketched by Tom Wolfe in his satirical novel The Bonfire of the Vanities, was part of the wasteland that was the South Bronx  entire blocks of the city, as he wrote, without a building left standing.

title: In China, an Action Hero Beats Box Office Records (and Arrogant Westerners)
description: BEIJING  Chinas new favorite action hero single-handedly routs pirates off the African coast in undersea combat. He wakes up fit to fight after nearly dying from a flesh-eating plague. He wields guns galore, poison arrows and a tank to wipe out the mercenaries led by the villainous Big Daddy, a swaggering, sneering American soldier of fortune.

title: From 2017: Confederate Monuments Are Coming Down Across the United States. Heres a List.
description: Many government officials have called to remove dozens of controversial statues, markers and other monuments from public grounds.

title: $16 Billion Bond Sale Shows Amazons Power to Pursue Deals
description: Amazons aggressive salesmanship now extends to its own debt.

title: Does Amazon Pay Taxes? Contrary to Trump Tweet, Yes
description: After President Trump accused Amazon on Wednesday morning of hurting local retailers and jobs by not paying taxes, the companys shares dipped in premarket trading.

title: An Artist Remakes a Film Classic  With Frankensteins Monster
description: The artist Alex Da Cortes elaborate installations are often carnivalesque, filled with strange sculptural objects (motorized plastic swans, an enormous box of Kleenex, a cat-shaped neon sign) and otherworldly environments. That makes Vienna Secession  one of the classic white cube galleries in Europe, where Da Corte is currently the subject of a solo show  a rather unexpected place to encounter his work. But, true to form, the artist has transformed the space into a kind of alien disco replete with velvet walls, multicolored carpets, clusters of bright lights and strange scattered objects: a toy chicken atop a plastic tube, an open umbrella, a bench made of a broomstick and a pink neon light.

title: Transit Group Proposes Extending Gateway Project to Reach Long Island
description: A $29 billion plan to build a new train tunnel under the Hudson River to Pennsylvania Station in Manhattan should be even more ambitious and allow trains to roll through the station from New York Citys suburbs in New Jersey to Long Island, an influential transit-advocacy group said on Wednesday.

title: Jillian Tamaki on The Sky Is Falling
Zimbabwes First Lady Said to Seek Diplomatic Immunity Over Assault Claim
description: HARARE, Zimbabwe  Zimbabwes first lady, Grace Mugabe, accused of attacking and injuring a young model she had found with her sons in a hotel room in South Africa, is seeking diplomatic immunity to fend off an assault charge, South African officials said on Wednesday.

title: Modern Love Podcast: Cynthia Nixon Reads Dear Dad: Weve Been Gay for a Really Long Time
description: On this weeks podcast, the actress Cynthia Nixon reads Dear Dad: Weve Been Gay for a Really Long Time, about siblings who come out to their conservative Mennonite father near the end of his life.

title: Trumps Fighting Words on Charlottesville
description: To the Editor:

title: A Personal, Breezy Tour of Classic Childrens Books
description: WILD THINGSThe Joy of Reading Childrens Literature as an AdultBy Bruce Handy307 pages. Simon & Schuster. $26.

title: American Boychoir School to Close
description: The students of the American Boychoir School in New Jersey have sung for presidents and the pope; collaborated with Beyonc, Yo-Yo Ma and Wynton Marsalis; and even inspired a movie starring Dustin Hoffman. But amid rocky finances, shrinking attendance and the lingering effects of a sexual abuse scandal, the 80-year-old school announced on Wednesday that it would close its doors.

title: Sessions Lauds Miami and Rebukes Chicago in Escalating Fight With Sanctuary Cities
description: WASHINGTON  Attorney General Jeff Sessions hailed local authorities in Miami on Wednesday for falling in line with federal immigration efforts but denounced Chicago and other so-called sanctuary cities that have escalated their rejection of Trump administration enforcement policies.

title: Im Grateful for What Taylor Swift Did: Readers React to the Verdict
description: Taylor Swifts unfiltered testimony about a former radio host who she said groped her attracted a lot of notice for its directness and for the skill with which she parried his lawyer. The trial was a rare, high-profile glimpse into the dynamics of sexual assault cases.

title: Inspired by Charlottesville, Military Chiefs Condemn Racism
description: In an unusually public move, the nations top military leaders, who typically try to steer clear of social controversy, have come out strongly against racism and extremism in the wake of violent protests over the weekend.

title: Why You Cant Trust Yourself to Match Photos of Strangers Faces
description: Matching up photos of strangers faces is surprisingly difficult, and the average person is likely to be duped by matching hairstyles.

title: Benghazi Suspects Statements in Ship Brig Will Be Allowed in Court
description: WASHINGTON  A federal judge on Wednesday denied a request by Ahmed Abu Khattala, the Libyan suspected of being a ringleader of the 2012 Benghazi attack, to suppress statements he made to interrogators in the brig of a Navy warship, rejecting arguments that the government violated his rights.

title: Texas Bathroom Bill Dies Again, Raising Republican Acrimony
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  A bill to restrict which bathroom transgender people can use in public buildings and schools died in the Texas Legislature on Tuesday evening, a rare defeat for social conservatives in a state they usually dominate.

title: Savor the Last of Summer With a Little Shopping
